weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Golem Greatbow is a uncommon Greatbow in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Its attack affinity is Pierce, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Golem Greatbow comes with Through And Through Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Greatbow
weapons.flavorText:
Enormous greatbow larger than any man. Can not be drawn with any ordinary level of strength, but the force of its shots is extraordinary.
A greatbow can only fire great arrows.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Greatbow is a common Greatbow in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Its attack affinity is Pierce, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Greatbow comes with Through And Through Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Lion Greatbow
weapons.flavorText:
Greatbow of black iron wielded by General Radahn. Decorated with a lion mane motif.
Imbued with gravitational power of the Starscourge, when used along with Radahn's Spear, it becomes a true weapon of a champion.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Lion Greatbow is a legendary Greatbow in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Its attack affinity is Pierce, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Lion Greatbow comes with Radahn's Rain Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Arbalest
weapons.flavorText:
Large crossbow made from composite materials. One of the largest of all bolt firing devices.
Its limbs are more pliable than metallic ones, allowing bolts fired from this weapon to pierce even forged of steel.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Arbalest is a common Crossbow in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical damage and has no attribute scaling.
Its attack affinity is Pierce, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Arbalest comes with Kick Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Crepus's Black-key Crossbow
weapons.flavorText:
Black crossbow featuring a long stock. Used for sniping, it has a very long range.
Weapon of Crepus, who served the Two Fingers from the shadows of the Roundtable as the head confessor.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Crepus's Black-key Crossbow is a uncommon Crossbow in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical damage and has no attribute scaling.
Its attack affinity is Pierce, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Crepus's Black-key Crossbow comes with Kick Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Heavy Crossbow
weapons.flavorText:
Heavy crossbow with iron limbs, increasing damage dealt.
Commonly employed in the Shattering.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Heavy Crossbow is a common Crossbow in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical damage and has no attribute scaling.
Its attack affinity is Pierce, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Heavy Crossbow comes with Kick Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Light Crossbow
weapons.flavorText: Ranged weapon made from a bow fixed to a stock. Deals good damage and is simple to use, but requires reloading after firing.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Light Crossbow is a common Crossbow in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical damage and has no attribute scaling.
Its attack affinity is Pierce, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Light Crossbow comes with Kick Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Soldier's Crossbow
weapons.flavorText: A crossbow of simple make, usable by anyone, but lacking in both power and accuracy.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Soldier's Crossbow is a common Crossbow in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical damage and has no attribute scaling.
Its attack affinity is Pierce, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Soldier's Crossbow comes with Kick Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Hand Ballista
weapons.flavorText:
An unconventional ballistic device modeled on a weapon used to besiege castles. Only capable of firing greatbolts.
Perfect for reckless acts such as storming a castle or facing an entire army alone.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Hand Ballista is a uncommon Ballista in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical damage and has no attribute scaling.
Its attack affinity is Pierce, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Hand Ballista comes with Kick Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Mantis Blade
weapons.flavorText:
A curved sword with a blade at both ends wielded by the Cemetery Shades, the insect-ridden grave keepers. 
The blade is thin and sharp, and strong attack unleashes a far-reaching slash.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Mantis Blade is a uncommon Curved Sword in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Its attack affinity is Slash, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Mantis Blade comes with  Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Executor's Blade
weapons.flavorText:
A single-edged katana with a long, sharp curved blade. A unique weapon wielded by the samurai from the Land of Reeds.
The Executor found the sword abondoned in the aftermath of a battle, and has wieldedit ever since. Stained with gold and rusted blood.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Executor's Blade is a legendary Katana in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Its attack affinity is Slash / Pierce, and it has innate Hemorrhage buildup on hit.
Executor's Blade comes with Unsheathe Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Raider's Greataxe
weapons.flavorText:
The Raider's preferred weapon, a greataxe fashioned from a ship's figurehead.
On his first voyage, the Raider vanquished countless pirates on the high seas. When a figurehead was dislodged from its ship during a tumultuos back-and-forth, the Raider claimed it for himself, that it might later server as a reminder of his glorious exploits.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Raider's Greataxe is a common Colossal Weapon in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical damage and has Strength scaling.
Its attack affinity is Standard, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Raider's Greataxe comes with Endure Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Revenant's Cursed Claw
weapons.flavorText:
A silver accessory that attaches claws to the ring and little fingers.
A lady bore the claw before meeting a horrific death, which transformed the claw into a fetish. Swing to slash enemies apart.
Only the Revenant can make proper use of this weapon, owing to her resonance with the spiritual. For other warriors, the claw is reduced to a blunt instrument.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Revenant's Cursed Claw is a common Claw in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical and Magic damage and has Strength and Faith scaling.
Its attack affinity is Strike / Slash, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Revenant's Cursed Claw comes with White Shadow's Lure Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Ironeye's Bow
weapons.flavorText:
A black, lustrous bow wielded by the Ironeye. One of the finest instruments crafted by the Fellowship.
The assassins of the Fellowship each wield unique weapons, such that targets marked for death anticipate all manner of approaches. Some of them, driven to the brink by fear, find relief by taking their own lives, before it is too late.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Ironeye's Bow is a common Bow in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Its attack affinity is Pierce, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Ironeye's Bow comes with Mighty Shot Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Pulley Crossbow
weapons.flavorText:
Crossbow made with pulleys and power springs. The complex mechanism, which required advanced mathematical and mechanical understanding to craft, was likely made by a certain genius who learned Golden Order fundamentalism.
One touch fires a volley of bolts.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Pulley Crossbow is a rare Crossbow in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical damage and has no attribute scaling.
Its attack affinity is Pierce, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Pulley Crossbow comes with Kick Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Full Moon Crossbow
weapons.flavorText:
One-of-a-kind enchanted crossbow of exquisitely detailed craftsmanship.
Made to celebrate the matrimonial union, and reconciliation, between the houses of the Erdtree and the Full Moon, Leyndell and Raya Lucaria. The two rings dance when reloading the weapon.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Full Moon Crossbow is a uncommon Crossbow in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical and Magic damage and has no attribute scaling.
Its attack affinity is Pierce, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Full Moon Crossbow comes with Kick Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Jar Cannon
weapons.flavorText:
Jar cannon which uses explosives to fire greatbolts. Deals great damage but is slow to reload.
Experimental firearm brought to the assault on Volcano Manor, where it was discovered that no one knew how to use it.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Jar Cannon is a rare Ballista in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical damage and has no attribute scaling.
Its attack affinity is Pierce, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Jar Cannon comes with Kick Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Torch
weapons.flavorText:
This torch's tip is wrapped in oil-soaked rags and set on fire. The flame can illuminate dark locales, or used to attack enemies.
Can be raised up when equipped in the left hand, illuminating more of the surrounding area.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Torch is a common Torch in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical and Fire damage and has Strength scaling.
Its attack affinity is Strike, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Torch comes with Torch Attack Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Beast-Repellent Torch
weapons.flavorText:
A torch which burns oil infused with a special incense. The aroma pacifies wild beasts.
Torches such as these were used to keep unwelcome beasts away from treasure troves hidden in caves.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Beast-Repellent Torch is a common Torch in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical and Fire damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Its attack affinity is Strike, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Beast-Repellent Torch comes with Torch Attack Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Steel-Wire Torch
weapons.flavorText:
Torch wound with metal wire. The flame can illuminate dark locales, or be used to attack enemies.
Heavier than a normal torch, but the heated filament boosts fire damage dealt.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Steel-Wire Torch is a uncommon Torch in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical and Fire damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Its attack affinity is Strike, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Steel-Wire Torch comes with Firebreather Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Sentry's Torch
weapons.flavorText:
Torch given to protectors of the Erdtree. Its flames are bestowed with a special incantation which allows the bearer to see assassins cloaked in veils.
Furnished on behalf of the Erdtree and the Grace-Given Lord such that a Night of Black Knives will never come again.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Sentry's Torch is a uncommon Torch in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical, Fire and Holy damage and has Strength, Dexterity and Faith scaling.
Its attack affinity is Strike, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Sentry's Torch comes with Torch Attack Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Ghostflame Torch
weapons.flavorText:
Metal torch that burns with cold ghostflame.
Tool of the Fallen Hawks who prowl the underground rivers.
When the band's last embers were used up in their long search,
they began to burn the bones of their fellows,
acquiring the cold ghostflame,
but sealing their fate as dwellers of the underground for all eternity.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Ghostflame Torch is a rare Torch in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical and Magic damage and has Strength, Dexterity and Intelligence scaling.
Its attack affinity is Strike, and it has innate Frostbite buildup on hit.
Ghostflame Torch comes with Torch Attack Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: St. Trina's Torch
weapons.flavorText:
Candlestand torch that burns with a light-purple flame. The carvings depict St. Trina, but in adult form, somewhat unnervingly.
The light-purple flame induces sleep.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
St. Trina's Torch is a rare Torch in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical and Fire damage and has Strength, Dexterity and Faith scaling.
Its attack affinity is Strike, and it has innate Sleep buildup on hit.
St. Trina's Torch comes with Fires of Slumber Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

catalysts.name: Academy Glintstone Staff
catalysts.flavorText:
Staff of the Academy of Raya Lucaria, embedded with a turquoise glintstone.
Only a recognized sorcerer is permitted to wield this staff.
catalysts.wikiCatalystDescriptionText:
Academy Glintstone Staff is a common Glintstone Staff in Elden Ring Nightreign. Direct attack with this armament deals Physical damage, and it has Strike attack affinity.
Although not very useful in melee combat, its power comes from its ability to cast wide range of Sorceries to inflict damage.
Academy Glintstone Staff spell power scales with Intelligence, and, as any other Glintstone Staff in the game, can be found with 2 random Sorceries

catalysts.name: Albinauric Staff
catalysts.flavorText:
Short staff with a blue glintstone embedded. Wielded by the Albinaurics of old.
The Albinaurics harbor a secret; they cast sorcery with their innate arcaneness.
catalysts.wikiCatalystDescriptionText:
Albinauric Staff is a uncommon Glintstone Staff in Elden Ring Nightreign. Direct attack with this armament deals Physical damage, and it has Strike attack affinity.
Although not very useful in melee combat, its power comes from its ability to cast wide range of Sorceries to inflict damage.
Albinauric Staff spell power scales with Intelligence, and, as any other Glintstone Staff in the game, can be found with 2 random Sorceries

catalysts.name: Astrologer's Staff
catalysts.flavorText:
Staff of the astrologers. A glintsone is embedded in the tip, enabling it to be used as a catalyst for sorceries.
Each staff holds the memories of two sorceries. Use normal and strong attacks to cast them.
catalysts.wikiCatalystDescriptionText:
Astrologer's Staff is a common Glintstone Staff in Elden Ring Nightreign. Direct attack with this armament deals Physical damage, and it has Strike attack affinity.
Although not very useful in melee combat, its power comes from its ability to cast wide range of Sorceries to inflict damage.
Astrologer's Staff spell power scales with Intelligence, and, as any other Glintstone Staff in the game, can be found with 2 random Sorceries

catalysts.name: Azur's Glintstone Staff
catalysts.flavorText: Staff of the primeval glintstone sorcerer Azur. Only those who have glimpsed what lies beyond the wisdom of stone may wield it.
catalysts.wikiCatalystDescriptionText:
Azur's Glintstone Staff is a rare Glintstone Staff in Elden Ring Nightreign. Direct attack with this armament deals Physical damage, and it has Strike attack affinity.
Although not very useful in melee combat, its power comes from its ability to cast wide range of Sorceries to inflict damage.
Azur's Glintstone Staff spell power scales with Intelligence, and, as any other Glintstone Staff in the game, can be found with 2 random Sorceries

catalysts.name: Carian Glintblade Staff
catalysts.flavorText:
Staff embedded with a blue glintstone. One of two types of Carian staff.
Gifted to enchanted knights, it enhances Glintblade sorceries.
catalysts.wikiCatalystDescriptionText:
Carian Glintblade Staff is a uncommon Glintstone Staff in Elden Ring Nightreign. Direct attack with this armament deals Physical damage, and it has Strike attack affinity.
Although not very useful in melee combat, its power comes from its ability to cast wide range of Sorceries to inflict damage.
Carian Glintblade Staff spell power scales with Intelligence, and, as any other Glintstone Staff in the game, can be found with 2 random Sorceries

catalysts.name: Carian Glintstone Staff
catalysts.flavorText:
Staff embedded with a blue glintstone. One of two types of Carian staff.
Given to sorcerers that they might enact the role of knight. Enhances Carian sword sorceries.
catalysts.wikiCatalystDescriptionText:
Carian Glintstone Staff is a uncommon Glintstone Staff in Elden Ring Nightreign. Direct attack with this armament deals Physical damage, and it has Strike attack affinity.
Although not very useful in melee combat, its power comes from its ability to cast wide range of Sorceries to inflict damage.
Carian Glintstone Staff spell power scales with Intelligence, and, as any other Glintstone Staff in the game, can be found with 2 random Sorceries

catalysts.name: Carian Regal Scepter
catalysts.flavorText:
Magic scepter of Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon. The glintstone is known as a Carian Blue.
Only those of the highest intelligence may wield this, the finest of all glintstone staves.
catalysts.wikiCatalystDescriptionText:
Carian Regal Scepter is a legendary Glintstone Staff in Elden Ring Nightreign. Direct attack with this armament deals Physical damage, and it has Strike attack affinity.
Although not very useful in melee combat, its power comes from its ability to cast wide range of Sorceries to inflict damage.
Carian Regal Scepter spell power scales with Intelligence, and, as any other Glintstone Staff in the game, can be found with 2 random Sorceries

catalysts.name: Crystal Staff
catalysts.flavorText:
Staff fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human.
The Crystalian's faint cognition is known as the "wisdom of stone." This staff can only be wielded by those of intellect high enough to grasp such wisdom.
catalysts.wikiCatalystDescriptionText:
Crystal Staff is a uncommon Glintstone Staff in Elden Ring Nightreign. Direct attack with this armament deals Physical damage, and it has Strike attack affinity.
Although not very useful in melee combat, its power comes from its ability to cast wide range of Sorceries to inflict damage.
Crystal Staff spell power scales with Intelligence, and, as any other Glintstone Staff in the game, can be found with 2 random Sorceries

catalysts.name: Demi-human Queen's Staff
catalysts.flavorText:
Glintstone staff styled as a scepter. A gift once given to the demi-humans to foster peace, it can be wielded even by those of low intelligence.
Sneered at by fools in the academy.
catalysts.wikiCatalystDescriptionText:
Demi-human Queen's Staff is a common Glintstone Staff in Elden Ring Nightreign. Direct attack with this armament deals Physical damage, and it has Strike attack affinity.
Although not very useful in melee combat, its power comes from its ability to cast wide range of Sorceries to inflict damage.
Demi-human Queen's Staff spell power scales with Intelligence, and, as any other Glintstone Staff in the game, can be found with 2 random Sorceries

catalysts.name: Digger's Staff
catalysts.flavorText: Staff of a sorcerer-miner who extracts glintstone from crystal tunnels. The staff itself is a tool used to mine, and the ferrule is also embedded with a glintstone.
catalysts.wikiCatalystDescriptionText:
Digger's Staff is a common Glintstone Staff in Elden Ring Nightreign. Direct attack with this armament deals Physical damage, and it has Strike attack affinity.
Although not very useful in melee combat, its power comes from its ability to cast wide range of Sorceries to inflict damage.
Digger's Staff spell power scales with Intelligence, and, as any other Glintstone Staff in the game, can be found with 2 random Sorceries

catalysts.name: Gelmir Glintstone Staff
catalysts.flavorText: Staff wielded by the Man-Serpents of Mt. Gelmir. It has a forked tip, and is embedded with red glintstones.
catalysts.wikiCatalystDescriptionText:
Gelmir Glintstone Staff is a uncommon Glintstone Staff in Elden Ring Nightreign. Direct attack with this armament deals Physical damage, and it has Strike attack affinity.
Although not very useful in melee combat, its power comes from its ability to cast wide range of Sorceries to inflict damage.
Gelmir Glintstone Staff spell power scales with Intelligence, and, as any other Glintstone Staff in the game, can be found with 2 random Sorceries

catalysts.name: Glintstone Staff
catalysts.flavorText:
Staff with a glintstone embedded at the tip. A catalyst for casting sorceries.
Each staff holds the memories of two sorceries. Use normal and strong attacks to cast them.
catalysts.wikiCatalystDescriptionText:
Glintstone Staff is a common Glintstone Staff in Elden Ring Nightreign. Direct attack with this armament deals Physical damage, and it has Strike attack affinity.
Although not very useful in melee combat, its power comes from its ability to cast wide range of Sorceries to inflict damage.
Glintstone Staff spell power scales with Intelligence, and, as any other Glintstone Staff in the game, can be found with 2 random Sorceries

catalysts.name: Lusat's Glintstone Staff
catalysts.flavorText: Staff of the primeval glintstone sorcerer Lusat. Only those who have glimpsed what lies beyond the wisdom of stone may wield it.
catalysts.wikiCatalystDescriptionText:
Lusat's Glintstone Staff is a rare Glintstone Staff in Elden Ring Nightreign. Direct attack with this armament deals Physical damage, and it has Strike attack affinity.
Although not very useful in melee combat, its power comes from its ability to cast wide range of Sorceries to inflict damage.
Lusat's Glintstone Staff spell power scales with Intelligence, and, as any other Glintstone Staff in the game, can be found with 2 random Sorceries

catalysts.name: Meteorite Staff
catalysts.flavorText: Staff embedded with a dark purple glintstone, said to be the fragment of a meteorite.
catalysts.wikiCatalystDescriptionText:
Meteorite Staff is a rare Glintstone Staff in Elden Ring Nightreign. Direct attack with this armament deals Physical damage, and it has Strike attack affinity.
Although not very useful in melee combat, its power comes from its ability to cast wide range of Sorceries to inflict damage.
Meteorite Staff spell power scales with Intelligence, and, as any other Glintstone Staff in the game, can be found with 2 random Sorceries

catalysts.name: Prince Of Death's Staff
catalysts.flavorText:
Staff embedded with sullied amber, said to be a very part of the Prince of Death.
One of the staves deemed heretical by the academy.
catalysts.wikiCatalystDescriptionText:
Prince Of Death's Staff is a rare Glintstone Staff in Elden Ring Nightreign. Direct attack with this armament deals Physical damage, and it has Strike attack affinity.
Although not very useful in melee combat, its power comes from its ability to cast wide range of Sorceries to inflict damage.
Prince Of Death's Staff spell power scales with Intelligence, and, as any other Glintstone Staff in the game, can be found with 2 random Sorceries

catalysts.name: Recluse's Staff
catalysts.flavorText:
A staff bound in red-drenched laurcls that curses foes. Serves as a catalyst for sorceries.
The laurels, imbued with a blood rite, unlock the peculiar fields of magic that flow through a given region. in the Lands Between, the staff invokes the strength of glintStones.
catalysts.wikiCatalystDescriptionText:
Recluse's Staff is a common Glintstone Staff in Elden Ring Nightreign. Direct attack with this armament deals Physical damage, and it has Strike attack affinity.
Although not very useful in melee combat, its power comes from its ability to cast wide range of Sorceries to inflict damage.
Recluse's Staff spell power scales with Intelligence, and, as any other Glintstone Staff in the game, can be found with 2 random Sorceries

catalysts.name: Rotten Crystal Staff
catalysts.flavorText: Staff fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human. It festers with scarlet rot.
catalysts.wikiCatalystDescriptionText:
Rotten Crystal Staff is a uncommon Glintstone Staff in Elden Ring Nightreign. Direct attack with this armament deals Physical damage, and it has Strike attack affinity.
Although not very useful in melee combat, its power comes from its ability to cast wide range of Sorceries to inflict damage.
Rotten Crystal Staff spell power scales with Intelligence, and, as any other Glintstone Staff in the game, can be found with 2 random Sorceries

catalysts.name: Staff Of Loss
catalysts.flavorText: Staff missing its glintstone. Wielded by sorcerers who believe that discovery comes through acts of asceticism.
catalysts.wikiCatalystDescriptionText:
Staff Of Loss is a uncommon Glintstone Staff in Elden Ring Nightreign. Direct attack with this armament deals Physical damage, and it has Strike attack affinity.
Although not very useful in melee combat, its power comes from its ability to cast wide range of Sorceries to inflict damage.
Staff Of Loss spell power scales with Intelligence, and, as any other Glintstone Staff in the game, can be found with 2 random Sorceries

catalysts.name: Staff Of The Guilty
catalysts.flavorText: A heretical staff fashioned from a smoldering, withered sapling that turns the blood of sacrifices pierced by it into glintstone. Similar to hex magic.
catalysts.wikiCatalystDescriptionText:
Staff Of The Guilty is a uncommon Glintstone Staff in Elden Ring Nightreign. Direct attack with this armament deals Physical damage, and it has Strike attack affinity.
Although not very useful in melee combat, its power comes from its ability to cast wide range of Sorceries to inflict damage.
Staff Of The Guilty spell power scales with Intelligence, and, as any other Glintstone Staff in the game, can be found with 2 random Sorceries

catalysts.name: Clawmark Seal
catalysts.flavorText:
Sacred seal granted by Gurranq, the Beast Clergyman.
The claw mark represents Gurranq's wrath.
catalysts.wikiCatalystDescriptionText:
Clawmark Seal is a uncommon Sacred Seal in Elden Ring Nightreign. Direct attack with this armament deals Physical damage, and it has Strike attack affinity.
Although not very useful in melee combat, its power comes from its ability to cast wide range of Incantations to inflict damage or cast supportive spells.
Clawmark Seal spell power scales with Faith, and, as any other Sacred Seal in the game, can be found with 2 random Incantations

catalysts.name: Dragon Communion Seal
catalysts.flavorText:
Formless drakeblood seal with a dragon communion crest.
The sacrificial devouring of the heart gives power.
Indeed, Dragon Communion is too primal in nature for the term "incantation" to be appropriate.
catalysts.wikiCatalystDescriptionText:
Dragon Communion Seal is a rare Sacred Seal in Elden Ring Nightreign. Direct attack with this armament deals Physical damage, and it has Strike attack affinity.
Although not very useful in melee combat, its power comes from its ability to cast wide range of Incantations to inflict damage or cast supportive spells.
Dragon Communion Seal spell power scales with Faith, and, as any other Sacred Seal in the game, can be found with 2 random Incantations

catalysts.name: Erdtree Seal
catalysts.flavorText:
A formless sacred seal decorated with an Erdtree crest, once the focus of religion in the Lands Between.
Even though the Elden Ring is shattered, and the Erdtree has dulled from its former radiance, earnest faith continues to hold the answers.
catalysts.wikiCatalystDescriptionText:
Erdtree Seal is a rare Sacred Seal in Elden Ring Nightreign. Direct attack with this armament deals Physical damage, and it has Strike attack affinity.
Although not very useful in melee combat, its power comes from its ability to cast wide range of Incantations to inflict damage or cast supportive spells.
Erdtree Seal spell power scales with Faith, and, as any other Sacred Seal in the game, can be found with 2 random Incantations

catalysts.name: Finger Seal
catalysts.flavorText:
A sacred seal bestowed by a Finger Maiden which serves as a catalyst for casting incantations.
Each sacred seal holds the memories of two incantations. Use normal and strong attacks to cast them.
catalysts.wikiCatalystDescriptionText:
Finger Seal is a common Sacred Seal in Elden Ring Nightreign. Direct attack with this armament deals Physical damage, and it has Strike attack affinity.
Although not very useful in melee combat, its power comes from its ability to cast wide range of Incantations to inflict damage or cast supportive spells.
Finger Seal spell power scales with Faith, and, as any other Sacred Seal in the game, can be found with 2 random Incantations

catalysts.name: Frenzied Flame Seal
catalysts.flavorText:
Formless sacred seal bestowed by the maiden of the Three Fingers.
This seal is the mark of the Lord of Frenzied Flame.
catalysts.wikiCatalystDescriptionText:
Frenzied Flame Seal is a rare Sacred Seal in Elden Ring Nightreign. Direct attack with this armament deals Physical damage, and it has Strike attack affinity.
Although not very useful in melee combat, its power comes from its ability to cast wide range of Incantations to inflict damage or cast supportive spells.
Frenzied Flame Seal spell power scales with Faith, and, as any other Sacred Seal in the game, can be found with 2 random Incantations

catalysts.name: Giant's Seal
catalysts.flavorText:
Sacred seal depicting the one-eyed god of the Fire Giants, adorned with braids of red hair.
Sacred seal wielded by Fire Monks and Prelates.
catalysts.wikiCatalystDescriptionText:
Giant's Seal is a uncommon Sacred Seal in Elden Ring Nightreign. Direct attack with this armament deals Physical damage, and it has Strike attack affinity.
Although not very useful in melee combat, its power comes from its ability to cast wide range of Incantations to inflict damage or cast supportive spells.
Giant's Seal spell power scales with Faith, and, as any other Sacred Seal in the game, can be found with 2 random Incantations

catalysts.name: Godslayer's Seal
catalysts.flavorText:
Sacred seal of the Godskin Apostles, inlaid with obsidian.
Said to represent the manipulation of black flame.
catalysts.wikiCatalystDescriptionText:
Godslayer's Seal is a uncommon Sacred Seal in Elden Ring Nightreign. Direct attack with this armament deals Physical damage, and it has Strike attack affinity.
Although not very useful in melee combat, its power comes from its ability to cast wide range of Incantations to inflict damage or cast supportive spells.
Godslayer's Seal spell power scales with Faith, and, as any other Sacred Seal in the game, can be found with 2 random Incantations

catalysts.name: Golden Order Seal
catalysts.flavorText:
A formless sacred seal depicting the ceremonial observation of Order.
Fundamentalism is scholarship in all but name.
catalysts.wikiCatalystDescriptionText:
Golden Order Seal is a rare Sacred Seal in Elden Ring Nightreign. Direct attack with this armament deals Physical damage, and it has Strike attack affinity.
Although not very useful in melee combat, its power comes from its ability to cast wide range of Incantations to inflict damage or cast supportive spells.
Golden Order Seal spell power scales with Faith, and, as any other Sacred Seal in the game, can be found with 2 random Incantations

catalysts.name: Gravel Stone Seal
catalysts.flavorText:
Sacred seal made from Gravel Stone thought to be an ancient dragon scale.
The worship of the ancient dragons does not conflict with belief in the Erdtree. After all, this seal, and lightning itself, are both imbued with gold.
catalysts.wikiCatalystDescriptionText:
Gravel Stone Seal is a uncommon Sacred Seal in Elden Ring Nightreign. Direct attack with this armament deals Physical damage, and it has Strike attack affinity.
Although not very useful in melee combat, its power comes from its ability to cast wide range of Incantations to inflict damage or cast supportive spells.
Gravel Stone Seal spell power scales with Faith, and, as any other Sacred Seal in the game, can be found with 2 random Incantations

shields.name: Blue-white Wooden Shield
shields.flavorText:
Small wooden roundshield that has been reinforced with metal. It is light and easy to handle, but cannot offer the damage negation of a true metal shield.
The design is said to represent the stars of the night sky, portending fate.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Blue-white Wooden Shield is a common Small Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Blue-white Wooden Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with  Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Buckler
shields.flavorText:
A small metal roundshield. The bump in the center is designed to parry.
A well-timed parry deflects an enemy's attack, breaking their stance and leaving them open to a critical hit. Though risk is inherent, this shield favors aggression.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Buckler is a common Small Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Buckler does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Buckler Parry Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Coil Shield
shields.flavorText:
Armament designed for gladiatorial combat. rises above its peers as a particularly showy specimen.
The sculpted bronze snake is a poisonous breed.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Coil Shield is a common Small Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Coil Shield has innate Poison buildup on hit, and comes with Viper Bite Ash of War (Weapon Skill)

shields.name: Gilded Iron Shield
shields.flavorText:
Small metal roundshield. Heavier than a wooden shield, but boasts higher damage negation.
Though the gold leaf is peeling and the effect is slight, it still boosts holy damage negation.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Gilded Iron Shield is a common Small Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Gilded Iron Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Parry Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Ice Crest Shield
shields.flavorText:
Small metal roundshield. Heavier than a wooden shield, but boasts higher damage negation.
The ice crest originates from a Carian princess. Though the effect is slight, it boosts magic damage negation.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Ice Crest Shield is a common Small Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Ice Crest Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with  Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Iron Roundshield
shields.flavorText:
An ordinary small roundshield made of metal. Heavier than a wooden shield, but boasts higher damage negation.
Finely balanced, this shield is easy to use.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Iron Roundshield is a common Small Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Iron Roundshield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with  Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Man-serpent's Shield
shields.flavorText:
Small copper dome-shaped roundshield carried by the man-serpents of Mt. Gelmir.
Said to have been tempered in lava, it boasts great resistance to fire.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Man-serpent's Shield is a common Small Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Man-serpent's Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with  Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Perfumer's Shield
shields.flavorText:
Golden shield used by the perfumers of Leyndell during military service.
Made to be thin and light of weight, even those lacking strength can employ this shield.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Perfumer's Shield is a common Small Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Perfumer's Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Parry Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Pillory Shield
shields.flavorText: Pillory made to punish serious felons, used as a shield. Though made of good, sturdy wood, it is only a makeshift tool and performs as such.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Pillory Shield is a common Small Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Pillory Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with  Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Red Thorn Roundshield
shields.flavorText:
A small, wooden roundshield. It is light and easy to use, but cannot offer the damage negation of a metal shield.
Its emblem is an ancient thorn design. Though it isn't much, it boosts fire damage negation
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Red Thorn Roundshield is a common Small Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Red Thorn Roundshield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Parry Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Rickety Shield
shields.flavorText:
A creaky old wooden shield, circular in shape. Roughly reinforced with vines.
There are countless other shields available of better make. This piece of scrap isn't worth the effort of equipping.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Rickety Shield is a common Small Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Rickety Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Parry Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Rift Shield
shields.flavorText:
Small metal roundshiled depicting a sinister rift.
An antiquated charm that glares back at an enemy.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Rift Shield is a common Small Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Rift Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with  Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Riveted Wooden Shield
shields.flavorText:
Small wooden roundshield that has been reinforced with metal. It is light and easy to handle, but cannot offer the damage negation of a true metal shield. 
The design riveted to the center represents both sword and tree.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Riveted Wooden Shield is a common Small Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Riveted Wooden Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Parry Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Scripture Wooden Shield
shields.flavorText:
A small, wooden roundshield. It is light and easy to handle, but cannot offer the damage negation of a metal shield.
An ancient cipher engraving lines the circumference. Though it isn't much, it boosts holy damage negation.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Scripture Wooden Shield is a common Small Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Scripture Wooden Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Parry Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Shield Of The Guilty
shields.flavorText:
Shield made to venerate a maiden whose eyes were crushed by Briars of Sin before being reborn in these lands.
The briars can be used to attack foes.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Shield Of The Guilty is a common Small Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Shield Of The Guilty has innate Hemorrhage buildup on hit, and comes with Shield Bash Ash of War (Weapon Skill)

shields.name: Smoldering Shield
shields.flavorText:
Small shield made upon Mt. Gelmir forged from uncooling lava.
When wielded as a weapon, its heat deals fire damage.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Smoldering Shield is a common Small Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical and Fire damage and has Strength, Dexterity and Faith scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Smoldering Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Shield Bash Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Spiralhorn Shield
shields.flavorText:
Small shield of antlers arranged in an eddy-like pattern. If used to attack a foe, the shield's antlers inflict blood loss.
Once given to a Tarnished warrior who cultivated close ties to the ancestral followers.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Spiralhorn Shield is a common Small Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Spiralhorn Shield has innate Hemorrhage buildup on hit, and comes with Parry Ash of War (Weapon Skill)

shields.name: Wylder's Small Shield
shields.flavorText:
A small, wooden roundshield. It is light and easy to handle, but cannot offer the damage negation of a metal shield.
The crest on the shield, of a particular style of a faraway land, is interpreted as a depiction of grasslands and blowing winds.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Wylder's Small Shield is a common Small Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Wylder's Small Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Buckler Parry Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Albinauric Shield
shields.flavorText:
Tall oval shield made of metal carried by young Albinaurics. The ornamentation represents the primordial drop of dew from which they are said to have been created.
Boasts exceptional magic damage negation. The Albinaurics' most formidable foes were sorcerers, after all.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Albinauric Shield is a common Medium Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Albinauric Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Parry Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Banished Knight's Shield
shields.flavorText:
A tall medium-sized metal shield. Given to knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.
Most of these knights were sent to the fringes, where they were forced to start anew with only despair for company.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Banished Knight's Shield is a common Medium Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Banished Knight's Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with  Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Beast Crest Heater Shield
shields.flavorText:
A medium-sized metal shield. Easier to handle than a kite shield.
Features a beast as its crest, serving to remind warriors not to succumb to the arousal of battle. Fight with passion, but become not its prisoner.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Beast Crest Heater Shield is a common Medium Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Beast Crest Heater Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Parry Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Beastman's Jar-shield
shields.flavorText:
Shield fashioned from a tall broken jar carried by the beastmen of Farum Azula. There is a particular knack to wielding it.
The beastmen have always fired earthenware jars for the express purpose of making shields. Such are their ways, strange though they are.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Beastman's Jar-shield is a common Medium Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Beastman's Jar-shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with  Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Black Leather Shield
shields.flavorText:
Roundshield covered in black leather. On the larger side for a medium-sized shield.
From the north, this shield depicts the polar star in rivets of gold. The inside is lined with fur, protecting the carrier from frost.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Black Leather Shield is a common Medium Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Black Leather Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with  Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Blue Crest Heater Shield
shields.flavorText:
A medium-sized metal shield. Easier to handle than a kite shield. 
The crest represents a forest and river.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Blue Crest Heater Shield is a common Medium Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Blue Crest Heater Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Parry Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Blue-gold Kite Shield
shields.flavorText:
A standard medium-sized shield. Highly reputed for its solid build and reliability.
The design represents the Erdtree foreground against a blue sky.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Blue-gold Kite Shield is a common Medium Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Blue-gold Kite Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Parry Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Brass Shield
shields.flavorText:
On the larger side for medium-sized shield, the face has been covered in brass.
Commonly employed in the Shattering.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Brass Shield is a common Medium Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Brass Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with  Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Candletree Wooden Shield
shields.flavorText:
A tall, medium-sized wooden shield. Light for its size, and easy to handle.
Thought to represent a surreptitious prophecy of cardinal sin, the lit candle-tree design was forbidden.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Candletree Wooden Shield is a common Medium Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Candletree Wooden Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Parry Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Carian Knight's Shield
shields.flavorText:
A teardrop-shaped, medium-sized shield embedded with blue glintstones. Carried by knights who served the Carian royal family.
Excels when facing magic or holy attacks. Just who were these knights preparing to fight?
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Carian Knight's Shield is a common Medium Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical and Magic damage and has Strength, Dexterity and Intelligence scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Carian Knight's Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with  Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Eclipse Crest Heater Shield
shields.flavorText:
A medium-sized metal shield. Easier to handle than a kite shield.
The sun in eclipse is said to be the symbol of the Wandering Mausoleum where the soulless demigods slumber.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Eclipse Crest Heater Shield is a common Medium Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Eclipse Crest Heater Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with  Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Flame Crest Wooden Shield
shields.flavorText:
A tall, medium-sized wooden shield. Light for its size, and easy to handle. Carried by soldiers of the village that is afflicted by frenzy.
The yellow flame is the symbol of the affliction, serving as a warning to those who might approach the village.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Flame Crest Wooden Shield is a common Medium Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Flame Crest Wooden Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Parry Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Great Turtle Shell
shields.flavorText:
Shield fashioned from a great turtle shell. The natural curve helps it contend with foes' attacks.
The turtle is a symbol of tirelessness.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Great Turtle Shell is a common Medium Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Great Turtle Shell does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Barricade Shield Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Hawk Crest Wooden Shield
shields.flavorText:
A tall, medium-sized wooden shield. Light for its size, and easy to handle.
Adorned with a long-forgotten crest of Stormveil, ancient in design.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Hawk Crest Wooden Shield is a common Medium Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Hawk Crest Wooden Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Parry Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Heater Shield
shields.flavorText:
A medium-sized metal shield, comparatively easy to handle. 
Metal shields are well trusted upon many a field of battle.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Heater Shield is a common Medium Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Heater Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Parry Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Horse Crest Wooden Shield
shields.flavorText:
A tall, medium-sized wooden shield. Light for its size, and easy to handle.
The circular horsehead design evokes a swift gallop.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Horse Crest Wooden Shield is a common Medium Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Horse Crest Wooden Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with  Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Inverted Hawk Heater Shield
shields.flavorText:
A medium-sized metal shield. Easier to handle than a kite shield.
The inverted hawk is the emblem of the company of slaves ordered to explore the Eternal City.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Inverted Hawk Heater Shield is a common Medium Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Inverted Hawk Heater Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Parry Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Kite Shield
shields.flavorText:
A standard medium-sized metal shield.
Metal shields are well trusted upon many a field of battle.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Kite Shield is a common Medium Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Kite Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with  Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Large Leather Shield
shields.flavorText:
A round shield covered in leather. One of the larger categories of medium-sized shield.
Though its damage negation may be lacking compared to a metal shield, it can handle wider range of attack affinities.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Large Leather Shield is a common Medium Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Large Leather Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Parry Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Marred Leather Shield
shields.flavorText:
Leather shield of Stormveil soldiers. Much like the castle, it is marred by mottling and thorns.
Some say it is the curse of grafting which causes such affliction, while others talk of its root being something altogether more sinister hidden deep within the castle.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Marred Leather Shield is a common Medium Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Marred Leather Shield has innate Hemorrhage buildup on hit, and comes with  Ash of War (Weapon Skill)

shields.name: Marred Wooden Shield
shields.flavorText:
Wooden shield of the Stormveil soldiers. Much like the castle, it is marred by mottling and thorns.
Some say it is the curse of grafting which causes such affliction, while others talk of its root being something altogether more sinister hidden deep within the castle.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Marred Wooden Shield is a common Medium Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Marred Wooden Shield has innate Hemorrhage buildup on hit, and comes with  Ash of War (Weapon Skill)

shields.name: Red Crest Heater Shield
shields.flavorText:
A medium-sized metal shield. Easier to handle than a kite shield.
The crest symbolizes red wings.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Red Crest Heater Shield is a common Medium Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Red Crest Heater Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Parry Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Round Shield
shields.flavorText:
A wooden roundshield that has been reinforced with metal.
Comparatively light for its size, this shield is easy to handle but lacks a true metal shield's ability to negate damage.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Round Shield is a common Medium Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Round Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Parry Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Scorpion Kite Shield
shields.flavorText:
A standard medium-sized metal shield. Highly reputed for its solid build and reliability.
Emblazoned with a yellow scorpion, a warning of surprise attacks and sudden strikes.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Scorpion Kite Shield is a common Medium Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Scorpion Kite Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Parry Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Silver Mirrorshield
shields.flavorText:
Shield of radiant silver, festooned with amber and carried by Loretta, Knight of the Haligtree.
The shape is said to imitate that of a sacred drop of dew, which inspired the absurd rumor that Loretta herself was an Albinauric.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Silver Mirrorshield is a common Medium Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical and Magic damage and has Strength, Dexterity and Intelligence scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Silver Mirrorshield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with  Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Sun Realm Shield
shields.flavorText:
Shield of honor depicting a city crowned by the sun. It has seen better days.
Much like the wear upon the shield, the Seat of the Sun is long faded away.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Sun Realm Shield is a common Medium Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Sun Realm Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Parry Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Twinbird Kite Shield
shields.flavorText:
Shield featuring a vividly painted twinbird.
The twinbird is said to be the envoy of an outer god, and mother of the Deathbirds.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Twinbird Kite Shield is a common Medium Shield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Twinbird Kite Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with  Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Ant's Skull Plate
shields.flavorText:
Huge head of one of the giant ants which inhabit the two underground rivers, used without modification as a shield. Excels at repeling enemy attacks.
Giant ants are venomous creatures.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Ant's Skull Plate is a common Greatshield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Ant's Skull Plate has innate Poison buildup on hit, and comes with Shield Bash Ash of War (Weapon Skill)

shields.name: Briar Greatshield
shields.flavorText:
Greatshield from a foreign land, used by Elemer of the Briar. Attacks with this armament utilize the iron thorns that have been wound around its frame.
Originates from Eochaid, a land of proudly solitary ascetics.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Briar Greatshield is a common Greatshield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Briar Greatshield has innate Hemorrhage buildup on hit, and comes with Shield Bash Ash of War (Weapon Skill)

shields.name: Crossed-tree Towershield
shields.flavorText:
An iron greatshield large enough to cover the entire body. Emblazoned with an old, interleaving tree.
Greatshields boast high damage negation and guard capacity, making enemy attacks easy to repel.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Crossed-tree Towershield is a common Greatshield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Crossed-tree Towershield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Shield Bash Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Crucible Hornshield
shields.flavorText:
Greatshield of red-tinged gold carried by Crucible Knights. Features a great horn.
An ancient holiness dwells within. The crucible horn skewers foes when performing shield bashes.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Crucible Hornshield is a common Greatshield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Crucible Hornshield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Shield Bash Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Cuckoo Greatshield
shields.flavorText:
Metal Greatshield painted with a peering cuckoo. Carried by the enchanted knights sworn to the academy.
Boasting high magic damage negation, this shield is used to hunt down mages.
Our enemy is none other than Caria itself.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Cuckoo Greatshield is a common Greatshield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Cuckoo Greatshield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with  Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Distinguished Greatshield
shields.flavorText:
Greatshield featuring sumptuous ornamentation used by the scions of great families.
Due to their excessive size, these shields were at times seen as the hallmark of little lordlings who were too timid to earn a few nicks and scratches.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Distinguished Greatshield is a common Greatshield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Distinguished Greatshield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with  Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Dragon Towershield
shields.flavorText:
Tower shield engraved with a dragon, symbol of protection. Heavy even among greatshields, it possesses exceptional guarding ability
The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Dragon Towershield is a common Greatshield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Dragon Towershield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Shield Bash Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Dragonclaw Shield
shields.flavorText:
Greatshield said to have been whittled from the claw of a great, ancient dragon, wielded by grotesque Tree Sentinels who yet serve the Erdtree.
Imbued with lightning.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Dragonclaw Shield is a common Greatshield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical and Lightning damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Dragonclaw Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Shield Bash Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Eclipse Crest Greatshield
shields.flavorText:
Metal greatshield painted with a sun in eclipse. Carried by the headless mausoleum knights.
The eclipsed sun, drained of color, is the protective star of soulless demigods. It aids the mausoleum knights by keeping Destined Death at bay.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Eclipse Crest Greatshield is a common Greatshield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Eclipse Crest Greatshield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with  Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Erdtree Greatshield
shields.flavorText:
Weighty greatshield forged of gold carried by the order of Tree Sentinels, heavily equipped knights. Blessed by an old incantation of protection.
The living rampart of the Erdtree, the Tree Sentinels are the standard to which all defenders of the Erdtree aspire.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Erdtree Greatshield is a common Greatshield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical and Holy damage and has Strength, Dexterity and Faith scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Erdtree Greatshield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Golden Retaliation Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Fingerprint Stone Shield
shields.flavorText:
A great stone shield with an intricately carved fingerprint design.
One of the heaviest of all greatshields. Part of the tomb of an ancient god, the Readerless Fingers relayed their message through these imprints, said to be the very seeds from which frenzy first sprouted.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Fingerprint Stone Shield is a common Greatshield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Fingerprint Stone Shield has innate Madness buildup on hit, and comes with Shield Bash Ash of War (Weapon Skill)

shields.name: Gilded Greatshield
shields.flavorText:
Metal greatshield coated with gold. Carried by knights loyal to Godrick.
The red tinge in the gold coat mirrors the primordial matter that became the Erdtree. The color of homeward yearning.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Gilded Greatshield is a common Greatshield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Gilded Greatshield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with  Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Golden Beast Crest Shield
shields.flavorText:
Shield of dull gold with a beast engraved as its crest. Lighter than most greatshields, and subsequently easier to wield.
The beast depicted is Serosh, aged counselor who guides the golden lineage.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Golden Beast Crest Shield is a common Greatshield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Golden Beast Crest Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with  Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Golden Greatshield
shields.flavorText:
Oval greatshield made of gold, carried by knights who protect the Royal Capital of Leyndell.
Knights of Leyndell are reputed for their sturdiness, exemplified by this shield's exceptional guard capacity.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Golden Greatshield is a common Greatshield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Golden Greatshield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with  Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Guardian's Greatshield
shields.flavorText:
A greatshield wielded by soldiers of the winged realm. Engraved with the crest of a wing, which also serves to reduce its weight.
The winged realm is populated entirely by Pinionfolk, for whom the wing is a proud symbol of their bloodline
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Guardian's Greatshield is a common Greatshield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Guardian's Greatshield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with  Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Haligtree Crest Greatshield
shields.flavorText:
Metal greatshield depicting the Haligtree with unalloyed gold. Carried by knights who have vowed to serve Miquella's Haligtree.Possesses high holy damage negation.
Yet now, with the Haligtree misshapen, this wondrous rendition is a fleeting fantasy.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Haligtree Crest Greatshield is a common Greatshield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Haligtree Crest Greatshield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with  Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Icon Shield
shields.flavorText:
Greatshield painted with a divine scene; the recipients of a blessed tear from the Erdtree. An item that looks back fondly on the age of plenty.
The divine scene acts in and of itself as a sacred invocation.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Icon Shield is a common Greatshield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Icon Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with  Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Inverted Hawk Towershield
shields.flavorText:
An iron greatshield large enough to cover the entire body. Features an inverted hawk crest.
Greatshields boast high damage negation and guard capacity, making enemy attacks easy to repel.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Inverted Hawk Towershield is a common Greatshield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Inverted Hawk Towershield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Shield Bash Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Jellyfish Shield
shields.flavorText:
The head of a spirit jellyfish, commonly found floating above sacred ground throughout the Lands Between, wielded without modification as a shield.
The see-through head is both supple and exceedingly light.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Jellyfish Shield is a common Greatshield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Jellyfish Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Contagious Fury Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Lordsworn's Shield
shields.flavorText:
Wooden tower shield. Lightweight for a greatshield and easy to handle. Commonly used in the Shattering.
Greatshields boast high damage negation and guard capacity, making enemy attacks easy to repel.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Lordsworn's Shield is a common Greatshield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Lordsworn's Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Shield Bash Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Manor Towershield
shields.flavorText:
An iron greatshield large enough to cover the entire body. Depicts the Roundtable Hold, gathering place of champions.
Greatshields boast high damage negation and guard capacity, making enemy attacks easy to repel.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Manor Towershield is a common Greatshield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Manor Towershield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Shield Bash Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: One-eyed Shield
shields.flavorText:
Tricksome shield made from white stone depicting a malformed one-eyed god. The barrel of a firearm pokes through the open mouth.
Once worshipped by the giants, this evil deity is believed to have been slain by Queen Marika.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
One-eyed Shield is a common Greatshield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. One-eyed Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Flame Spit Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Redmane Greatshield
shields.flavorText: Greatshield shaped like a fang, featuring the crest of red-maned lion. Carried by the Redmane Knights who fought alongside Radahn.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Redmane Greatshield is a common Greatshield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Redmane Greatshield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with  Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Spiked Palisade Shield
shields.flavorText:
A large wooden shield covered with spikes. Though relatively light, it lacks in damage negation.
Designed to perform shield bashes, these attacks riddle the enemy with holes, earning it the nickname of "pard shield"
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Spiked Palisade Shield is a common Greatshield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Spiked Palisade Shield has innate Hemorrhage buildup on hit, and comes with Shield Bash Ash of War (Weapon Skill)

shields.name: Visage Shield
shields.flavorText:
Tricksome bronze shield depicting the face of a Fire Giant. Several tongues leap from its open mouth.
The dreadful visage and burning flames are designed to remind one of the horror of facing a Fire Giant. In other words, this shield has an instructional function.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Visage Shield is a common Greatshield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Visage Shield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with Tongues Of Fire Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

shields.name: Wooden Greatshield
shields.flavorText:
Wooden greatshield reinforced with a metal ornamentation.
Greatshields boast high damage negation and guard capacity, making enemy attacks easy to repel.
shields.wikiShieldDescriptionText:
Wooden Greatshield is a common Greatshield in Elden Ring Nightreign. This shield deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Being a shield, its attack affinity is Strike. Wooden Greatshield does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
This shield also comes with  Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

consumables.name: Acid Spraymist
consumables.effectDescription: Releases acidic mist and lowers attack
consumables.flavorText:
Forbidden art of depraved perfumers.
 Releases an acidic mist from user's mouth that travels forwards, damaging armaments and temporarily lowering attack power. Perfumed powder is held in the mouth to dissolve before being expelled. It was once a restorative art, or so it is said.

consumables.name: Alluring Pot
consumables.effectDescription: Throw at enemies to lure human-build foes
consumables.flavorText:
Pot enchanted with assassin incantations.
 Throw at enemies to create a pale shadow. The illusion will lure in and distract foes of human frame.

consumables.name: Ancestral Infant's Head
consumables.effectDescription: Uses FP to spray spirit vapor
consumables.flavorText:
Skull of a very young ancestral spirit. Just think how many sproutings It might bear.
 Uses FP to spray spirit vapor, inflicting magic damage. The vapor becomes a temporary geyser which deals continuous damage to everything it touches until it disappears.

consumables.name: Beastlure Pot
consumables.effectDescription: Throw at enemies to lure beastly prey
consumables.flavorText:
Pot enchanted with assassin incantations.
 Throw at enemies to create a red shadow. The illusion lures in beasts into attacking it.

consumables.name: Bewitching Branch
consumables.effectDescription: Contact briefly makes allies of foes
consumables.flavorText:
Tree branch blessed with an incantation of unalloyed gold.
 Thrust branch forward to release a beguiling mist, entrancing foes such that they temporarily join your cause. The Empyrean Miquella is loved by many people. Indeed, he has learned very well how to compel such affection.

consumables.name: Bloodboil Aromatic
consumables.effectDescription: Raises attack but also damage received
consumables.flavorText:
Forbidden art of depraved perfumers.
 Induces a temporary state of fervor, raising maximum attack power and stamina while also increasing damage received. "Even upon the battlefield, do you fear being wounded? Take a good look. Your limbs are frozen stiff."

consumables.name: Blood Grease
consumables.effectDescription: Coats armament, inflicting blood loss
consumables.flavorText:
Solidified grease made from a mixture of blood-red materials.
 Coats armament, inflicting blood loss. The effect lasts only for a short time.

consumables.name: Boiled Crab
consumables.effectDescription: Greatly boosts physical damage negation for a time
consumables.flavorText:
Boiled crab meat. A prime specimen of plump and moist meat. True connoisseurs know how to keep from over-salting.
 Greatly boosts physical damage negation for a certain duration. Unlike the "rawn" sold, this trul is crab. Not that it matters, it's delicious all the same.

consumables.name: Boiled Prawn
consumables.effectDescription: Boosts physical damage negation for a time
consumables.flavorText:
Boiled prawn meat. A prime specimen of plump and moist meat. True connoisseurs know how to keep from over-salting.
 Boosts physical damage negation for a certain duration. The meat actually looks to have come from a crayfish. Not that it matters, it's delicious all the same.

consumables.name: Clarifying Boluses
consumables.effectDescription: Alleviates madness buildup
consumables.flavorText:
Yellow boluses made of cave moss.
 Alleviates madness buildup.
Also boosts resistance and gradually restores HP. Madness accumulates slowly, inflicting heavy damage and reducing FP once the threshold is reached. Take one of these in timely fashion to avoid such an event.

consumables.name: Crystal Dart
consumables.effectDescription: Throw at enemies to inflict magic damage
consumables.flavorText:
Throwing knife chiseled from impure crystal.
 Throw at enemies to deal magic damage. Long ago, it is said that a golem crafter employed a similar crystal tool.

consumables.name: Cuckoo Glintstone
consumables.effectDescription: Launch magic bolt straight ahead
consumables.flavorText:
Lump of broken glintstone enwreathed with magic power.
