 A "faux sorcery" used by the Knights of the Cuckoo. Launched straight ahead. Magic bolts spring forth from the point of impact.

consumables.name: Dragonwound Grease
consumables.effectDescription: Boosts anti-dragon and physical attack
consumables.flavorText:
Solidified grease made from a gravel-stone mixture.
 Coats armament, granting an anti-dragon effect and boosting physical attack. The effect lasts only for a short time. When the dragons were born from their ancient kin, they lost their stone scales, which can now be used to cause them mortal harm.

consumables.name: Exalted Flesh
consumables.effectDescription: Temporarily boosts physical attack
consumables.flavorText:
A lump of animal flesh pickled in a medicinal solution mixed with fiery spices.
 Temporarily boosts physical attack. Considered a delicacy in the badlands, this invigorating repast was for the exclusive benefit of those who they deem heroes.

consumables.name: Fan Daggers
consumables.effectDescription: Throw fanned-out knives at enemies to inflict damage
consumables.flavorText:
A set of five throwing knives bundled together. A concealed weapon cherished by the raptor assassins.
 The thin knives fan out when thrown, dealing damage to the target. Each knife deals paltry damage, but the wide range makes it suitable for constraining enemies.

consumables.name: Fetid Pot
consumables.effectDescription: Throw at enemies to cause buildup of deadly poison
consumables.flavorText:
A cocktail of effluents sealed inside a pot. As the mixture ferments, toxins are produced alongside a putrid stench that seeps out once ripe.
 Throw at enemies to cause buildup of deadly poison. Beware though; those who carry these pots will slowly accumulate poison in their own bodies. Push someone in a privy; expect to get dung on your hands.

consumables.name: Fire Grease
consumables.effectDescription: Coats armament, inflicting fire damage
consumables.flavorText:
Solidified grease made from a mixture of incendiary materials.
 Coats armament, adding fire damage to attacks.
The effect lasts only for a short time.

consumables.name: Fire Pot
consumables.effectDescription: Throw at enemies to inflict fire damage
consumables.flavorText:
A cocktail of incendiary materials sealed inside a pot.
 Throw at enemies to inflict fire damage.

consumables.name: Freezing Grease
consumables.effectDescription: Coats armament, inflicting frost
consumables.flavorText: Solidified grease made from a mixture of frozen materials. Coats armament, inflicting frost. The effect lasts only for a short time.

consumables.name: Freezing Pot
consumables.effectDescription: Throw at enemies to cause buildup of frost
consumables.flavorText:
A pot engraved with the crest of the Carian Royals.
 Throw at enemies to cause buildup of frost. Originates from the cold, dark moon of Ranni, the Carian princess.

consumables.name: Glintstone Scrap
consumables.effectDescription: Crush gem to produce a magic bolt
consumables.flavorText:
Piece of glintstone tinged with unstable magic.
 Found in crystal tunnels. Crush gem to produce magic bolts. Poor quality and thereby easily broken, a sorcerer wouldn't give it a second look.

consumables.name: Gold-pickled Fowl Foot
consumables.effectDescription: Boosts rune acquisition for a time
consumables.flavorText:
Four-toed foot of a fowl, pickled in a golden medicinal solution.
 Boosts the amount of runes obtained from defeating enemies for a certain duration. Since old times, the needy would scrape the meat clean even from a fowl's claw.

consumables.name: Gravity Stone Chunk
consumables.effectDescription: Throw at foe to cause a gravitational explosion
consumables.flavorText:
Shard of rock found in the wake of a meteorite strike. It is imbued with a particularly weighty magic.
 Throw at enemies to cause a gravitational explosion. The desperate ones who scavenge for these shards dub themselves "starcallers."

consumables.name: Gravity Stone Fan
consumables.effectDescription: Throw near foes to make fan-shaped gravitational shockwave
consumables.flavorText:
Shard of rock found in the wake of a meteorite strike.
It is imbued with a particularly weighty magic.
 Throw near foes to make fan-shaped gravitational shockwave. The desperate ones who scavenge for these shards dub themselves "starcallers."

consumables.name: Holy Grease
consumables.effectDescription: Coats armament, inflicting holy damage
consumables.flavorText:
Solidified grease made from a mixture of holy resonant materials.
 Coats armament, adding holy damage to attacks.
The effect lasts only for a short time.

consumables.name: Holy Water Pot
consumables.effectDescription: Throw at enemies to inflict holy damage
consumables.flavorText:
Enchanted by incantations of the Golden Order.
 Throw at enemies to inflict holy damage. Highly effective against Those Who Live in Death, even preventing them from rising again. The Golden Order has no mercy for those who trespass beyond life's bounds.

consumables.name: Ironjar Aromatic
consumables.effectDescription: Raises defenses but lowers mobility
consumables.flavorText:
Forbidden art of depraved perfumers.
 Temporarily turns body to steel, boosting poise, resistances and damage negation at the expense of mobility and lightning resistance. An art that requires fragments of hunted noble jars. Depraved perfumers are plainly in league with jar poachers.

consumables.name: Kukri
consumables.effectDescription: Throw at enemies to inflict damage and build up onset of blood loss
consumables.flavorText:
A large knife used for throwing. Its cuwed blade is sharp enough to slice flesh cleanly.
 Throw at enemies to inflict damage and build up onset of blood loss. This heavy throwing weapon is unsuitable for swift attacks, but is able to inflict heavy damage.

consumables.name: Magic Grease
consumables.effectDescription: Coats armament, inflicting magic damage
consumables.flavorText:
Solidified grease made from a mixture of magically resonant materials.
 Coats armament, adding magic damage to attacks.
The effect lasts only for a short time.

consumables.name: Lightning Pot
consumables.effectDescription: Throw at enemies to inflict lightning damage
consumables.flavorText:
A cocktail of fulminating materials sealed inside a pot.
 Throw at enemies to inflict lightning damage.

consumables.name: Lightning Grease
consumables.effectDescription: Coats armament, inflicting lightning damage
consumables.flavorText:
Solidified grease made from a mixture of fulminating materials.
 Coats armament, adding lightning damage to attacks.
The effect lasts only for a short time.

consumables.name: Large Glintstone Scrap
consumables.effectDescription: Crush gem to produce many magic bolts
consumables.flavorText:
Large piece of glintstone tinged with unstable magic. Found in crystal tunnels.
 Crush gem to produce magic bolts. Poor quality and thereby easily broken, a sorcerer wouldn't give it a second look.

consumables.name: Magic Pot
consumables.effectDescription: Throw at enemies to inflict magic damage
consumables.flavorText:
A cocktail of magically resonant materials sealed inside a pot. Called a "faux sorcery" in Raya Lucaria.
 Throw at enemies to inflict magic damage.

consumables.name: Neutralizing Boluses
consumables.effectDescription: Alleviates Poison buildup and cures poison
consumables.flavorText:
Green boluses made from cave moss.
 Alleviates poison buildup and cures poison ailment. Also boosts resistance and gradually restores HP. Poison accumulates gradually, coming into effect once the threshold is reached. Poison ailment lowers HP in steady increments for a period.

consumables.name: Omen Bairn
consumables.effectDescription: Uses FP to unleash wraiths that chase down foes
consumables.flavorText:
Doll of a curseborn bairn.
 Uses FP to unleash wraiths that chase down foes. Omen babies have all their horns excised, causing most to perish. These fetishes are made to memorialize them. "Please, don't hate me, or curse me. Please."

consumables.name: Pickled Turtle Neck
consumables.effectDescription: Temporarily boosts stamina recovery
consumables.flavorText:
Turtle neck meat, pickled in a bitter medicinal solution.
 Temporarily boosts stamina recovery. The nutrients churn through the body, practically boiling out endless power.

consumables.name: Poisonbone Dart
consumables.effectDescription: Throw at enemies to inflict damage and build up poison
consumables.flavorText:
Animal bone sharpened into a knife for throwing, with a poison- laced tip.
 Throw at enemies to inflict damage and build up poison.

consumables.name: Poison Spraymist
consumables.effectDescription: Releases a poison mist that travels forwards
consumables.flavorText:
Forbidden art of depraved perfumers.
 Releases a poison mist from user's mouth that travels forwards, causing a buildup of poison. Perfumed powder is held in the mouth to dissolve before being expelled. It was once a restorative art, or so it is said.

consumables.name: Poison Pot
consumables.effectDescription: Throw at enemies to cause buildup of poison
consumables.flavorText:
A cocktail of poisonous materials sealed inside a pot.
 Throw at enemies to cause buildup of poison.

consumables.name: Poison Grease
consumables.effectDescription: Coats armament, inflicting poison
consumables.flavorText:
Solidified grease made from a mixture of poison-green materials.
 Coats armament, inflicting poison.
The effect lasts only for a short time.

consumables.name: Preserving Boluses
consumables.effectDescription: Alleviates scarlet rot buildup and cures rot
consumables.flavorText:
Scarlet boluses made of cave moss.
 Alleviates scarlet rot buildup and cures rot aliment. Also boosts resistance and gradually restores HP. Scarlet rot accumulates gradually, coming into effect once the threshold is reached. Scarlet rot ailment greatly lowers HP in steady increments for a period.

consumables.name: Rancor Pot
consumables.effectDescription: Throw at enemies to spawn vengeful spirits
consumables.flavorText:
Pot enchanted by the ancient death hex.
 Throw at enemies to spawn vengeful spirits that chase down foes. In times of old, the dead were burned with ghostflame, and from those cinders arose vengeful spirits.

consumables.name: Regal Omen Bairn
consumables.effectDescription: Uses FP to unleash many wraiths that chase down foes
consumables.flavorText:
Doll of a curseborn bairn from the Erdtree's royal line.
 Uses PP to unleash many wraiths that chase down foes. Omen babies born of royalty do not have their horns excised, but instead are kept underground, unbeknownst to anyone, imprisoned for eternity. These memorial fetishes are fashioned in secret.

consumables.name: Rejuvenating Boluses
consumables.effectDescription: Alleviates death blight buildup
consumables.flavorText:
Black boluses made of cave moss.
 Alleviates death blight buildup.
Also boosts resistance and gradually restores HP. Blight accumulates slowly, causing instant death once the threshold is reached. Take one of these in timely fashion to avoid such an event.

consumables.name: Silver-pickled Fowl Foot
consumables.effectDescription: Temporarily boosts item discovery
consumables.flavorText:
Four-toed foot of a fowl, pickled in a silvery medicinal solution.
 Temporarily boosts item discovery. Since old times, the needy would scrape the meat clean even from a fowl's claw.

consumables.name: Shield Grease
consumables.effectDescription: Boosts guarding ability and all damage negation
consumables.flavorText:
Solidified grease made from a mixture ofmagically resonant materials.
 Coats left-hand armament, boosting guarding ability and all forms ofdamage negation. The effect lasts only for a short time. Primarily used on shields.

consumables.name: Rot Pot
consumables.effectDescription: Throw at enemies to cause buildup of scarlet rot
consumables.flavorText:
A pot decorated with the crest of scarlet wings.
 Throw at enemies to cause buildup of scarlet rot. The rot bubbles up from the Swamp of Aeonia, and eats away at life like a vicious plague.

consumables.name: Rot Grease
consumables.effectDescription: Coats armament, inflicting scarlet rot
consumables.flavorText:
Solidified grease made from a mixture of rotten materials.
 Coats armament, inflicting scarlet rot.
The effect lasts only for a short time.

consumables.name: Sleep Pot
consumables.effectDescription: Throw at enemies to cause buildup of sleep
consumables.flavorText:
Pot enchanted by the incantations of St. Trina.
 Throw at enemies to cause buildup of sleep. Like a lullaby, or a quagmire, its light-purple haze irresistibly draws its victims down into sleep. Sweet dreams.

consumables.name: Soporific Grease
consumables.effectDescription: Coats armament, inflicting sleep
consumables.flavorText:
Solidified grease made from a mixture of light-purple materials.
 Coats armament, inflicting sleep.
The effect lasts only for a short time.

consumables.name: Spark Aromatic
consumables.effectDescription: Broadly scatter sparks in a wide area
consumables.flavorText:
Art of the perfumers who fought in the Shattering.
 Broadly scatters sparks in a wide arc straight ahead. Though fire was prohibited to those who served the Erdtree, this rule was forgotten as the war drew ever on.

consumables.name: Stanching Boluses
consumables.effectDescription: Alleviates impending blood loss
consumables.flavorText:
Red boluses made from cave moss.
Alleviates impending blood loss.
Also boosts resistance and gradually restores HP.
 Blood 1055 escalates gradually, causing great damage once the threshold is reached. Take one of these in timely fashion to avoid such an event.

consumables.name: Thawfrost Boluses
consumables.effectDescription: Alleviates buildup of Frost.
consumables.flavorText:
Ice-hued boluses made from cave moss.
 Alleviates buildup of frost and cures frostbite ailment. Also boosts resistance and gradually restores HP. Frost accumulates gradually, causing damage and inflicting frostbite once the threshold is reached. Vulnerability to damage increases for a certain duration.

consumables.name: Swarm Pot
consumables.effectDescription: Throw to release a swarm of bloodflies
consumables.flavorText:
A cocktail of effluents sealed inside a pot.
 Throw at enemies to set a swarm of bloodflies upon them. The Vile swarm deals damage and builds up onset of blood loss. The cacophony of their wings assails the sanity of berserkers. The maggots found in waste feed on blood and turn into vicious flies that are pitiably short-lived.

consumables.name: Stimulating Boluses
consumables.effectDescription: Alleviates buildup of sleep
consumables.flavorText:
Light-purple boluses made from cave moss.
 Alleviates buildup of sleep.
Also boosts resistance and gradually restores HP. Sleep accumulates gradually, causing sudden fogginess and loss of PP once the threshold is reached, even if it does not force the afflicted into true slumber. Take one of these in timely fashion to avoid such an event.

consumables.name: Starlight Shards
consumables.effectDescription: Restores FP
consumables.flavorText:
An ephemeral sliver that gives off a pale blue glow. What remains of a passing flash of starlight.
 Restores FP. A prized item that was once used in the Eternal City as an ingredient in intoxicating draughts.

consumables.name: Throwing Dagger
consumables.effectDescription: Throw at enemies to inflict damage
consumables.flavorText:
Short dagger for throwing. It has no handguard.
 The blade is polished, and its weight is expertly balanced. Throw at enemies to deal damage. This auxiliary weapon, used primarily to constrain an enemy's movements, can still be deadly in the right hands.

consumables.name: Uplifting Aromatic
consumables.effectDescription: Boosts attack power and reduces incoming damage once
consumables.flavorText:
Art of the perfumers who fought in the Shattering.
 Raises the attack power of the user and nearby allies while also reducing the damage from one incoming attack by half. This aromatic has an extremely potent morale-raising effect that makes those accustomed to it fearless in the face of death. It was this influence that made the perfumers exceptional commanders.

consumables.name: Volcano Pot
consumables.effectDescription: Creates heat cloud, causing continuous fire damage
consumables.flavorText:
Powdered volcanic rock sealed inside a pot.
 Throw at enemies to disperse a cloud of heat, dealing continuous damage to those caught inside for a short duration.

consumables.name: Warming Stone
consumables.effectDescription: Continuously heal nearby allies
consumables.flavorText:
Ruin Fragment blessed with an incantation of the Two Fingers.
 Generates warmth where activated, continuously restoring the HP of nearby allies. It's said that the Erdtree was once as warm as the gentle sun, and would gradually heal all who bathed in its rays.

consumables.name: Wraith Calling Bell
consumables.effectDescription: Uses FP to ring bell and calls prowling wraiths
consumables.flavorText:
Bell used by worshippers of revenants.
 Ring bell, using FP to summon prowling wraiths. This can be done multiple times in a row. Wraiths are said to be the vengeful spirits of those who died when cursed.

consumables.name: Cerulean Crystal Tear
consumables.effectDescription: Greatly restores FP.
consumables.flavorText:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Greatly restores FP.

consumables.name: Cerulean Hidden Tear
consumables.effectDescription: Eliminates all FP consumption.
consumables.flavorText:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
 Eliminates all FP consumption. However, this effect is only brief and will quickly expire.

consumables.name: Cord End
consumables.effectDescription: Gain entry somewhere.
consumables.flavorText: Gain entry somewhere.

consumables.name: Crimson Bubbletear
consumables.effectDescription: Automatically heals one's HP when HP is low.
consumables.flavorText:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
 Automatically heals one's HP when HP is low. However, this effect only occurs once, and will expire after a certain duration.

consumables.name: Flame-Shrouding Cracked Tear
consumables.effectDescription: Temporarily boosts the power of one's fire attacks.
consumables.flavorText:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
 Temporarily boosts the power of one's fire attacks.

consumables.name: Flask of Crimson Tears
consumables.effectDescription: Restores HP with use
consumables.flavorText:
A sacred flask modelled after a golden holy chalice that was once graced by a tear of blessing.
Filled with crimson tears, this flask restores HP with use. It will replenish itself after a period of time, but touching a Site of Grace will restore it immediately.

consumables.name: Greenburst Crystal Tear
consumables.effectDescription: Temporarily boosts stamina recovery speed.
consumables.flavorText:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
 Temporarily boosts stamina recovery speed.

consumables.name: Greenspill Crystal Tear
consumables.effectDescription: Temporarily raises one's maximum stamina.
consumables.flavorText:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
 Temporarily raises one's maximum stamina.

consumables.name: Holy-Shrouding Cracked Tear
consumables.effectDescription: Temporarily boosts the power of one's holy attacks.
consumables.flavorText:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
 Temporarily boosts the power of one's holy attacks.

consumables.name: Leaden Hardtear
consumables.effectDescription: Temporarily boosts one's poise.
consumables.flavorText:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
 Temporarily boosts one's poise.

consumables.name: Lightning-Shrouding Cracked Tear
consumables.effectDescription: Temporarily boosts the power of one's lightning attacks.
consumables.flavorText:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
 Temporarily boosts the power of one's lightning attacks.

consumables.name: Magic-Shrouding Cracked Tear
consumables.effectDescription: Temporarily boosts the power of one's magic attacks.
consumables.flavorText:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
 Temporarily boosts the power of one's magic attacks.

consumables.name: Opaline Bubbletear
consumables.effectDescription: Provides significant damage negation.
consumables.flavorText:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
 Provides significant damage negation. However, this effect only occurs once, and will expire after a certain duration.

consumables.name: Opaline Hardtear
consumables.effectDescription: Temporarily boosts all forms of damage negation.
consumables.flavorText:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
 Temporarily boosts all forms of damage negation.

consumables.name: Ruptured Crystal Tear
consumables.effectDescription: This concoction explodes when consumed.
consumables.flavorText:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
 This concoction explodes when consumed. A defective crystal tear which possesses absolutely no medicinal qualities. A lesson said to be learned the hard way for some; faith can be a volatile matter, after all.

consumables.name: Small Pouch
consumables.effectDescription: Increases item equip slots.
consumables.flavorText:
A handmade leather pouch gifted to departing travelers.
Increases item equip slots.
Any self-respecting adventurer will make ample use these helpful pouches that can keep an assortment of trusted tools within easy reach.

consumables.name: Smithing Stone [1]
consumables.effectDescription: Stone used to smith a variety of armaments.Makes a Common (white) item into Rare (blue)
consumables.flavorText:
Stone used to smith a variety of armaments.
A shard found in plenty throughout the Lands Between.
Use at a smithing table to strengthen common armaments. Smithing stone is found throughout the Lands Between, and mining galleries built to excavate it can be found everywhere.

consumables.name: Smithing Stone (2)
consumables.effectDescription: Stone used to smith a variety of armaments.Allows players to upgradeBluearmaments toPurple.
consumables.flavorText:
Stone used to smith a variety of armaments.
A large shard which is semivitrified. Use at a smithing table to strengthen uncommon armaments.
Thought to have been used to hone the weapons of the champions of the War against the Giants at the birth of the Erdtree.

consumables.name: Speckled Hardtear
consumables.effectDescription: Temporarily raises all resistances and heals all status ailments.
consumables.flavorText:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
 Temporarily raises all resistances and heals all status ailments.

consumables.name: Spiked Cracked Tear
consumables.effectDescription: Increases the power of charged attacks for a certain duration.
consumables.flavorText:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
 Increases the power of charged attacks for a certain duration.

consumables.name: Stonebarb Cracked Tear
consumables.effectDescription: Shortly makes one's attacks more likely to break enemy stances
consumables.flavorText:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
 Makes one's attacks more likely to break enemy stances. However, the effect lasts only for a short time.

consumables.name: Stonesword Key
consumables.effectDescription: Breaks the seal on imp statues
consumables.flavorText:
A sword-shaped stone key.
Breaks the seal on imp statues, but remains embedded in the statue after use, meaning it can only be used once as an item.
Think well before using one.

consumables.name: Thorny Cracked Tear
consumables.effectDescription: Makes consecutive attacks grow stronger the longer they continue
consumables.flavorText:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
 Makes consecutive attacks grow stronger the longer they continue. However, the effect lasts only for a short time.

consumables.name: Wending Grace
consumables.effectDescription: Allows one to rise from defeat a single time
consumables.flavorText:
An afterglow of lost grace unleashed by the tide of Night.
Allows one to rise from defeat a single time. Will take effect when kept in possessions. Lost upon use.
The world crumbles. And yet light, forgetful ofits own path, still seeks a follower to bestow guidance upon, summoning again grace once lost.

consumables.name: Windy Crystal Tear
consumables.effectDescription: Increases the effectiveness of dodge rolls
consumables.flavorText:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
 Increases the effectiveness of dodge rolls for a certain duration. However, damage taken is also increased during the concoction's effect.

spells.name: Glintstone Pebble
spells.effectDescription: Fires magic projectiles from glintstone.
spells.flavorText:
The most basic glintstone sorcery of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
The glintstone serves as a conduit, launching magical projectiles at foes. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion.
This is a universal first step on the journey to true knowledge of sorcery.

spells.name: Swift Glintstone Shard
spells.effectDescription: Swiftly fires magic projectiles from glintstone
spells.flavorText:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
The glintstone serves as a conduit, launching swift magical projectiles at foes. This sorcery can be used without delay after performing another action.
Those unworthy of the stone crown typically end their brief journey into sorcery here.

spells.name: Great Glintstone Shard
spells.effectDescription: Fires larger magic projectiles from glintstone.
spells.flavorText:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
The glintstone serves as a conduit, launching large magical projectiles at foes. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion.
Those unworthy of the stone crown typically end their brief journey into sorcery here.

spells.name: Glintstone Cometshard
spells.effectDescription: Fires a magic comet with a trailing tail
spells.flavorText:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
Fires a magical comet with a trailing tail. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion. Charging enhances potency.
A sorcery of the Karolos Conspectus, the most venerable of the academy.

spells.name: Comet
spells.effectDescription: Fires a great magic comet.
spells.flavorText:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
Fires a great magical comet. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion. Charging
enhances potency.
The greatest of the Karolos Conspectus's sorceries, that only a very few sorcerers have ever mastered.

spells.name: Shard Spiral
spells.effectDescription: Fire twin spiraling projectiles.
spells.flavorText:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
Fires twin projectiles that form a spiral as they travel. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion.
Charging enhances potency.
A sorcery of the Karolos Conspectus, the most venerable of the academy. This was the product of a failed attempt to create a new comet.

spells.name: Glintstone Stars
spells.effectDescription: Fires guided magic shooting stars
spells.flavorText:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
Fires three magic shooting stars that pursue the target. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. Charging enhances potency.
A sorcery of the Olivinus Conspectus, which attracts sorcerers from Sellia, Town of Sorcery.

spells.name: Star Shower
spells.effectDescription: Fires six shooting stars that pursue foes.
spells.flavorText:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
Fires six magic shooting stars that pursue the target. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. Charging enhances potency.
The most difficult to master of the Olivinus Conspectus sorceries.

spells.name: Glintstone Arc
spells.effectDescription: Launches a horizontally-widening magic arc.
spells.flavorText:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
Fires a horizontal arc of magic that spreads outward. This sorcery can be cast repeteadly and while in motion.
Granted to sorcererers who depart from the academy to embark on journeys, in order to fend off large groups of would-be adversaries. Fools often roam in packs.

spells.name: Crystal Barrage
spells.effectDescription: Fires a volley of glintstone crystal shards.
spells.flavorText:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
Fires a volley of glintstone crystal shards. Charging increases potency.
A sorcery of the Crystal Cadre, a group of sorcerers who pursue the wisdom of stone - the secrets locked in the faint cogitation of the Crystalians.

spells.name: Crystal Burst
spells.effectDescription: Fires a burst of glintstone crystal shards.
spells.flavorText:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
Fires a burst of glintstone crystal shards. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion. Charging increases potency.
A sorcery of the Crystal Cadre, a group of sorcerers who pursued the wisdom of stone - the secrets locked in the faint cogitation of the Crystalians.

spells.name: Cannon Of Haima
spells.effectDescription: Lobs an explosive magic projectile in an arc.
spells.flavorText:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
Lobs an explosive magic projectile that flies in an arc. Charging enhances potency.
Drawn from the conspectus of Haima, the adjudicator of the academy, this sorcery employs might as a means to quell conflict.

spells.name: Gavel Of Haima
spells.effectDescription: Attacks using a magic greathammer.
spells.flavorText:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
Creates a magical greathammer and slams it down. Allows one follow-up attack.
Drawn from the scholarly conspectus of Haima, the adjudicator of the academy, this sorcery employs might as a means to quell conflict.

spells.name: Shatter Earth
spells.effectDescription: Thrust staff into ground to emit a shockwave.
spells.flavorText:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
Imbues the ferrule of the caster's staff with magic, then thrusts it into the ground to create a magical shockwave. Allows one follow-up attack.
A Stonedigger sorcery used by the glintstone miners of the crystal tunnel. At the academy, use of this sorcery was a stigma that marked out failed scholars.

spells.name: Rock Blaster
spells.effectDescription: Thrust staff into ground to emit a massive shockwave.
spells.flavorText:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
Imbues the ferrule of the caster's staff with magic, then thrusts it into the ground to create a massive magical shockwave.
Hold to continue moving without striking the ground, and then push the end of the staff into enemies.
An enhanced version of the glintstone miners' Stonedigger sorcery.

spells.name: Scholar's Armament
spells.effectDescription: Enchants right-hand armament with magic damage.
spells.flavorText:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
Enchants armaments held in the right hand with magic-affinity attacks. This sorcery can be cast while in motion.
Taught to the Knights of the Cuckoo by the academy as payment for their contract.

spells.name: Scholar's Shield
spells.effectDescription: Enhances left-hand shield damage negation.
spells.flavorText:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
Enchants shield held in the left hand with additional damage negation. This sorcery can be cast while in motion.
Taught to the Knights of the Cuckoo by the academy as payment for their contract.

spells.name: Terra Magica
spells.effectDescription: Raises the magic strength of those within the sigil.
spells.flavorText:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
Draws an academy sigil upon the ground, raising the magic strength of those within.
Once, the sigil would be cast from the highest belfry of the academy, covering the entire institution's grounds. This spell allows such vivid experience of spellcasting success, it turns many a fledgling into a true sorcerer in a flash of newfound understanding.

spells.name: Thops's Barrier (spell)
spells.effectDescription: Erect a magic forcefield to deflect spells.
spells.flavorText:
The lifelong pursuit of Thops the Bluntstone.
Creates a magic forcefield that deflects sorceries and incantations. Hold to continuously create barriers.
Future generations will learn. They will know the foolishness of the sneering sorcerers who ridiculed this theory, little realizing that it was in fact a discovery worthy of a new conspectus of the academy.

spells.name: Comet Azur
spells.effectDescription: Fires a tremendous comet within a starry torrent.
spells.flavorText:
Legendary sorcery devised by Azur, primeval sorcerer.
Fires a tremendous comet in a torrent akin to the distant starry expanse, the place said to be the origin of glintstone.
Hold to continue releasing the sorcery's power.
When Azur glimpsed into the primeval current, he saw darkness. He was left both bewitched and fearful of the abyss.

spells.name: Stars Of Ruin
spells.effectDescription: Fire twelve dark shooting stars that pursue foes.
spells.flavorText:
Legendary sorcery devised by Lusat, primeval sorcerer. 
Fires twelve dark shooting stars that pursue the target. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. Charging increases potency.
When Lusat glimpsed into the primeval current, he beheld the final moments of a great star cluster, and upon seeing it, he too was broken.

spells.name: Founding Rain Of Stars
spells.effectDescription: Releases a downpour of star rain for a while.
spells.flavorText:
The eldest primeval sorcery, said to have been discovered by an ancient astrologer. A sorcery of legendary status.
Summons a dark cloud of stars overhead. Shortly after, the cloud will release a violent deluge of star rain. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. Charging increases potency.
Thought to be the founding glintstone sorcery. The glimpse of the primeval current that the astrologer saw became real, and the stars' amber rained down on this land.

spells.name: Magic Glintblade
spells.effectDescription: Creates sigil that forms a projectile glintblade after delay.
spells.flavorText:
An old sorcery of the Carian Royal Family.
Creates a sigil overhead, from which an enemy-seeking glintblade appears after a brief delay. This sorcery can be used while in motion. Charging increases the delay. 
Said to be the prototype of the sword-phalanx sorceries wielded by royal enchanted knights.

spells.name: Glintblade Phalanx
spells.effectDescription: Forms a defensive arch of magic glintblades.
spells.flavorText:
One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.
Creates a defensive arch of larger magic glintblades overhead, which automatically attack nearby foes. This sorcery can be cast while in motion.
Bestowed upon the enchanted Carian knights, who combined this art with their swordsmanship to maintain pressure upon their foes, striking in waves of steel and sorcery.

spells.name: Carian Phalanx
spells.effectDescription: Forms a defensive arch of numerous magic glintblades.
spells.flavorText:
One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.
Creates a defensive arch of numerous magic glintblades overhead, which automatically attack nearby foes.
This sorcery can be used cast while in motion.
An enhanced version of the glintblade sorcery used by enchanted knights.

spells.name: Greatblade Phalanx
spells.effectDescription: Forms a defensive arch of larger magic glintblades.
spells.flavorText:
One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.
Creates a defensive arch of larger magic glintblades overhead, which automatically attack nearby foes.
Used by the enchanted troll knights. They were the comrades of the young Rennala, bound by oath.

spells.name: Magic Downpour
spells.effectDescription: Summon a magic mass that sprays projectiles over area.
spells.flavorText:
One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.
Summons a mass of magic that fires projectiles over a wide area. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. Charging extends duration.
Said to have been taught by the Crystalians to mark the swearing of the old concord.

spells.name: Loretta's Greatbow
spells.effectDescription: Fires great arrow from a magic greatbow.
spells.flavorText:
Sorcery used by Royal Knight Loretta.
Creates a magic greatbow and fires a great arrow. Charging enhances potency. Hold to keep the great arrow nocked.
It is said that the bow was Loretta's favored weapon.

spells.name: Loretta's Mastery
spells.effectDescription: Fires four great arrows from a magic greatbow at once.
spells.flavorText:
Sorcery used by Loretta, Knight of the Haligtree.
Creates a magic greatbow and fires four great arrows simultaneously. Charging enhances potency. Hold to keep the great arrows nocked.
Developed by Loretta after her long, bloody journey to seek out a place where the Albinaurics could live in peace.

spells.name: Rennala's Full Moon
spells.effectDescription: Incarnate a full moon and launch it at foes.
spells.flavorText:
Sorcery symbolic of the Carian queen.
Uses the caster as a vessel to incarnate a full moon, then sends it floating toward foes. The full moon dispels all sorcery that touches it, and temporarily reduces magic damage negation for those it strikes.
Queen Rennala encountered this enchanting moon when she was young, and later, it would bewitch the academy.

spells.name: Ranni's Dark Moon
spells.effectDescription: Incarnate a cold, dark moon and launch it at foes.
spells.flavorText:
Legendary sorcery symbolic of the Carian queen. 
Uses the caster as a vessel to incarnate a cold, dark moon, then sends it floating toward foes. The dark moon dispels all sorcery that touches it, and temporarily reduces magic damage negation for those it strikes.
This moon was encountered by a young Ranni, led by the hand of her mother, Rennala. What she beheld was cold, dark and veiled in occult mystery.

spells.name: Carian Slicer
spells.effectDescription: Performs swift sweeping slash using magical sword.
spells.flavorText:
One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.
Conjures a magic sword and delivers a swift sweeping slash. 
This sorcery can be used without delay after performing another
action.
Even among the Carian sword sorceries, this is a notably effective technique.

spells.name: Carian Greatsword
spells.effectDescription: Performs sweeping slash using magical greatsword.
spells.flavorText:
One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.
Conjures a magic greatsword and then delivers a sweeping blow.
This sorcery can be cast repeatedly.
Armed with this spell, sorcerers gain the strength of knights, their loyalty sworn to the moon.

spells.name: Carian Piercer
spells.effectDescription: Impales foes with magical greatsword.
spells.flavorText:
One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.
Conjures a magic greatsword to impale foes. Charging lengthens the initial step in.
This sorcery forms a counterpart to Carian Greatsword. Highly lethal when used against single foes riding alone.

spells.name: Adula's Moonblade
spells.effectDescription: Sweeping slash followed by cold blade projectile.
spells.flavorText:
Sorcery of Adula, the Glintstone Dragon.
Conjures a cold magic greatsword, then delivers a sweeping blow that launches a blade-like projectile of frost. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly.
Adula, a devourer of sorcerers, was bested by Ranni and subsequently swore a knightly oath to her Dark Moon.

spells.name: Carian Retaliation
spells.effectDescription: Dispels enemy spells and retaliates with glintblades.
spells.flavorText:
One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.
Swing your staff to dispel incoming sorceries and incantations, using their power to retaliate with glintblades.
This was the Carian royal family's secret means to prepare against the disloyalty of the academy. The moon and stars would one day go their separate ways.

spells.name: Ambush Shard
spells.effectDescription: Strikes from behind with projectile fired from distance.
spells.flavorText:
One of the night sorceries of Sellia, Town of Sorcery.
Launches a projectile from a distance removed from the caster, so as to strike the enemy from behind.
This sorcery can be cast repeatedly.
The Sellian sorcerers were assassins, and it is said that they often hunted their fellows.

spells.name: Night Shard
spells.effectDescription: Swiftly fires a semi-invisible magic projectile.
spells.flavorText:
One of the night sorceries of Sellia, Town of Sorcery.
Swiftly fires a semi-invisible projectile. This sorcery can be used without delay after performing another action.
The Sellian sorcerers were assassins, and it is said that they often hunted their fellows.

spells.name: Night Comet
spells.effectDescription: Fires a semi-invisible magic comet.
spells.flavorText:
One of the night sorceries of Sellia, Town of Sorcery.
Fires a semi-invisible magic comet. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion. Charging enhances potency.
The Sellian sorcerers were assassins, and it is said that they often hunted their fellows.

spells.name: Night Maiden's Mist
spells.effectDescription: Releases life-sapping silver mist before caster.
spells.flavorText:
One of the night sorceries of Sellia, Town of Sorcery.
Releases a life-sapping silver mist before the caster, dealing damage 
to all caught within, including the caster. This sorcery can be cast 
while in motion.
Below Sellia, the Eternal City of Nokron sleeps. This sorcery
originates from the maiden of that place.

spells.name: Eternal Darkness
spells.effectDescription: Creates a dark space that draws in spells.
spells.flavorText:
Forbidden sorcery of Sellia, Town of Sorcery.
Creates a space of darkness that draws in sorceries and 
incantations. This sorcery can be cast while in motion.
Originally a lost sorcery of the Eternal City; the despair that
brought about its ruin made manifest.

spells.name: Magma Shot
spells.effectDescription: Fires lump of magma that explodes on contact.
spells.flavorText:
One of the sorceries developed from the magma of Mt. Gelmir.
Fires a lump of magma that explodes on contact. Charging enhances potency.
After discovering the ancient hexes of Gelmir, Rykard, son of Queen Rennala, brought them back into practical use as new forms of sorcery.

spells.name: Roiling Magma
spells.effectDescription: Fires lump of magma that explodes after delay.
spells.flavorText:
One of the sorceries developed from the magma of Mt. Gelmir.
Fires a lump of condensed magma that explodes a short delay after hitting the target.
Charging enhances potency and further delays the explosion.
After discovering the ancient hexes of Gelmir, Rykard, son of Queen Rennala, brought them back into practical use as new forms of sorcery.

spells.name: Gelmir's Fury
spells.effectDescription: Covers area with surge of magma from the earth.
spells.flavorText:
One of the sorceries developed from the magma of Mt. Gelmir.
Conjures a surge of magma from the earth, covering the area.
Charging extends the surge of magma.
This sorcery is held to represent the fury of the volcano, but the arrogance of attempting to harness it is solely that of men and serpents.

spells.name: Rykard's Rancor
spells.effectDescription: Releases searing spirits that repeatedly explode after delay.
spells.flavorText:
The terrible power of Rykard, Lord of Blasphemy. 
Summons searing spirits that leave a trail of delayed explosions in their wake.
These spirits manifest from the rancor of heroes who met a violent end. The lord granted them an audience, whereupon they were welcomed by the maw of the great serpent -- and within the serpent's bowels, they became the lord's kin.

spells.name: Glintstone Icecrag
spells.effectDescription: Fires mass of cold magic from glintstone.
spells.flavorText:
Sorcery said to have been used by the old snow witch.
The glintstone serves as a conduit, launching a mass of cold magic.
This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion.
The snowy crone taught the young Ranni to fear the dark moon
as she imparted her cold sorcery.

spells.name: Freezing Mist
spells.effectDescription: Releases cold mist before caster.
spells.flavorText:
Sorcery said to have been used by the old snow witch.
Releases a cold mist before the caster. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. Charging enhances range of the mist.
The snowy crone taught the young Ranni to fear the dark moon as she imparted her cold sorcery.

spells.name: Frozen Armament
spells.effectDescription: Enchants right-hand armament with frost.
spells.flavorText:
Sorcery said to have been used by the old snow witch.
Enchants armament held in the right hand with frost.
This sorcery can be cast while in motion.
The snowy crone taught the young Ranni to fear the dark moon as she imparted her cold sorcery.

spells.name: Zamor Ice Storm
spells.effectDescription: Thrust staff into ground to create freezing tornado.
spells.flavorText:
Ice sorcery of the Town of Zamor.
Strike the ground with the staff to create a freezing tornado.
Charging enhances potency.
Cloaked in icy tempests, the knights of Zamor have challenged the 
Fire Giants since ancient times.

spells.name: Shattering Crystal
spells.effectDescription: Creates crystal mass that shatters in forward burst.
spells.flavorText:
Sorcery of the mysterious Crystalians.
Creates a mass of crystal, then shatters it in a forward burst.
Charging enhances potency.
The Crystalians are inorganic beings, yet they live. They cleave close to the ideals of the primeval current, and as such, they are revered guests of the sorcerers.

spells.name: Crystal Torrent
spells.effectDescription: Creates crystal mass that fires stream of crystal shards.
spells.flavorText:
Sorcery of the mysterious Crystalians.
Creates a mass of crystal, then fires off shards in rapid succession.
Hold to continue firing shards.
The wrath of the Crystalians encapsulated in sorcery. Each shard is of substantial size, making even a stray blow capable of inflicting a severe wound.

spells.name: Crystal Release
spells.effectDescription: Scours area with violent rain of crystal shards.
spells.flavorText:
Sorcery of the mysterious Crystalians.
Creates a mass of crystal, then shatters it to scour a wide area with a violent rain of crystal shards.
This sorcery is used by high-ranking adepts among the Crystalians. Some also call this sorcery "the Crystal Sun."

spells.name: Gravity Well
spells.effectDescription: Pulls foes toward caster with gravity projectile.
spells.flavorText:
One of the glintstone sorceries that manipulates gravitational forces.
Fires a projectile of condensed gravitational force. Those struck by it will be pulled toward the caster.
Charging enhances potency.
A gravitational technique studied by the young Radahn. His master was an Alabaster Lord with skin of stone.

spells.name: Collapsing Stars
spells.effectDescription: Pulls foes toward caster with gravity projectile volley.
spells.flavorText:
One of the glintstone sorceries that manipulates gravitational forces.
Fires numerous gravitational projectiles. Any foes struck will be pulled toward the caster. Charging enhances potency.
A gravitational technique mastered by the young Radahn. "I thank you for your tutelage, for now I can challenge the stars."

spells.name: Rock Sling
spells.effectDescription: Summons rocks from the earth and sends its flying.
spells.flavorText:
One of the glintstone sorceries that manipulates gravitational forces. 
Pulls a clump of rocks from the earth and sends them flying. This sorcery can be cast while in motion.
A gravitational technique studied by the young Radahn. His master was an Alabaster Lord with skin of stone.

spells.name: Meteorite
spells.effectDescription: Calls small meteors down from the sky.
spells.flavorText:
One of the glintstone sorceries that manipulates gravitational forces.
Summons a void that emits a rain of small meteorites.
Hold to continue the effect.
The sorcery originates from the Onyx Lords, who had skin of stone, and were called lords in reverential fear of their destructive power.

spells.name: Meteorite Of Astel
spells.effectDescription: Calls a hail of small meteorites from the void.
spells.flavorText:
One of the glintstone sorceries that manipulates gravitational forces.
Summons a void that emits a hail of meteorites.
Hold to continue the effect.
A manifestation of the power with which Astel leveled the Eternal City.

spells.name: Oracle Bubbles
spells.effectDescription: Launches several small magic bubbles.
spells.flavorText:
Sorcery of the claymen who served as priests in the ancient dynasty.
Produces several small magical bubbles that drift towards foes before they naturally pop.
Charging increases the delay before the bubbles pop.
The claymen search for lost oracles within their bubbles.

spells.name: Great Oracular Bubble (spell)
spells.effectDescription: Launches a large magic bubble.
spells.flavorText:
Sorcery of the claymen who served as priests in the ancient dynasty.
Produces a gigantic magical bubble that drifts towards foes before it naturally ruptures.
Charging increases the delay before the bubble pops.
The claymen search for lost oracles within their bubbles.

spells.name: Briars Of Sin
spells.effectDescription: Summons thorns from a whorl of own blood.
spells.flavorText:
An aberrant sorcery discovered by exiled criminals. Theirs are the sorceries most reviled by the academy.
Wounds the caster with thorns of sin, creating a spiral of 
bloodthorns. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly, up to three times.
The guilty, their eyes gouged by thorns, lived in eternal darkness.
There, they discovered the blood star.

spells.name: Briars Of Punishment
spells.effectDescription: Wounds caster to unleash trail of bloodthrorns.
spells.flavorText:
An aberrant sorcery discovered by exiled criminals. Theirs are the sorceries most reviled by the academy.
Wounds the caster with thorns of punishment, sending a trail of bloodthorns running over the ground to impale enemies from below.
This sorcery can be cast repeatedly.
The guilty, their eyes gouged by thorns, lived in eternal darkness. There, they discovered the blood star.

spells.name: Rancorcall
spells.effectDescription: Summons vengeful spirits that chase down foes.
spells.flavorText:
Sorcery of the servants of Death.
Summons vengeful spirits that chase down foes. Charging enhances potency. 
Once thought lost, this ancient death hex was rediscovered by the necromancer Garris.

spells.name: Ancient Death Rancor
spells.effectDescription: Summons horde of vengeful spirits that chase down foes.
spells.flavorText:
Sorcery of the servants of Death.
Summons a horde of vengeful spirits that chase down foes.
Charging enhances potency.
They are cinders of the ancient death hex, raked from the fires of ghostflame by Deathbirds.

spells.name: Explosive Ghostflame
spells.effectDescription: Causes ghostflame explosion that burns wide area.
spells.flavorText:
Sorcery of the servants of Death.
Strike the ground with the staff, triggering an explosion of ghostflame that burns the surrounding area.
In the time when there was no Erdtree, death was burned in ghostflame. Deathbirds were the keepers of that fire.

spells.name: Tibia's Summons
spells.effectDescription: Summons Those Who Live in Death.
spells.flavorText:
Sorcery of the servants of Death.
Summons a group of Those Lost in Death. Three skeletons will appear some distance from the caster and attack foes before disappearing.
The dead have long been left to wander; what they need is leadership.

spells.name: Urgent Heal
spells.effectDescription: Heals a small amount of HP.
spells.flavorText:
Incantation of the Two Fingers' faithful.
Heals a small amount of HP. This incantation can be cast while in motion.
The Two Fingers has high hopes for the Tarnished; that even if they should be wounded, even should they fall, they will continue to fight for their duty.

spells.name: Heal
spells.effectDescription: Heals HP for you and nearby allies.
spells.flavorText:
Incantation of the Two Fingers' faithful.
Heals HP for the caster and nearby allies. Hold to continue praying and delay activation.
The Two Fingers has high hopes for the Tarnished; that even if they should be wounded, even should they fall, they will continue to fight for their duty.

spells.name: Great Heal
spells.effectDescription: Greatly Heals HP for self and nearby allies.
spells.flavorText:
Superior incantation of the Two Fingers' faithful.
Greatly heals HP for the caster and nearby allies. Hold to continue praying and delay activation.
The Two Fingers has high hopes for the Tarnished; that even if they should be wounded, even should they fall, they will continue to fight for their duty.

spells.name: Lord's Heal
spells.effectDescription: Massively heals HP for self and nearby allies.
spells.flavorText:
Incantation bestowed by the Two Fingers upon the Tarnished deemed worthy of becoming a lord.
Heals a massive amount of HP for the caster and nearby allies. Hold to continue praying and delay activation.
Tarnished - O, Tarnished! Seek the Erdtree and stand before Marika, its Queen. Become the Elden Lord!

spells.name: Magic Fortification
spells.effectDescription: Increases magic damage negation.
spells.flavorText:
Incantation of the Two Fingers' faithful.
Increases magic damage negation. This incantation can be cast while in motion.
Follow the path that has been set for you, and you will make enemies of all others: the monks, the sorcerers, the ancient dragon knights, and the scions of gold. Heed me  the Lands Between offers no welcome to the Tarnished.

spells.name: Flame Fortification
spells.effectDescription: Increases fire damage negation.
spells.flavorText:
Incantation of the Two Fingers' faithful.
Increases fire damage negation. This incantation can be cast while in motion.
Follow the path that has been set for you, and you will make enemies of all others: the monks, the sorcerers, the ancient dragon knights, and the scions of gold. Heed me  the Lands Between offers no welcome to the Tarnished.

spells.name: Lightning Fortification
spells.effectDescription: Increase lightning damage negation.
spells.flavorText:
Incantation of the Two Fingers' faithful.
Increases lightning damage negation. This incantation can be cast while in motion.
Follow the path that has been set for you, and you will make enemies of all others: the monks, the sorcerers, the ancient dragon knights, and the scions of gold. Heed me  the Lands Between offers no welcome to the Tarnished.

spells.name: Divine Fortification
spells.effectDescription: Increases holy damage negation.
spells.flavorText:
Incantation of the Two Fingers' faithful.
Increases holy damage negation. This incantation can be cast while in motion.
Follow the path that has been set for you, and you will make enemies of all others: the monks, the sorcerers, the ancient dragon knights and the scions of gold. Heed me  the Lands Between offers no welcome to the Tarnished.

spells.name: Lord's Divine Fortification
spells.effectDescription: Greatly increases holy damage negation incl. allies
spells.flavorText:
Incantation taught to Gideon the All-Knowing by the Two Fingers.
Greatly increases holy damage negation for the caster and nearby allies.
Hold to continue praying and delay activation.
Gideon gained true knowledge after his long exchange with the Two Fingers - discovering all had been broken long ago; that the trembling fingers, bent with age, and the Erdtree itself, were no exception.

spells.name: Rejection
spells.effectDescription: Produces a shockwave that pushes away foes.
spells.flavorText:
Incantation of the Two Fingers' faithful.
Produces a shockwave that knocks back nearby foes. Charging increases the size of the shockwave.
Hark, Tarnished! If you truly walk in faith, you must be prepared to reject all else.

spells.name: Shadow Bait
spells.effectDescription: Creates shadow that lures the aggression of foes of human build.
spells.flavorText:
Incantation of the Two Fingers' servants, who once served as the assassins of the Roundtable Hold.
Creates a pale gold shadow before the caster, luring foes of human build and attracting their aggression. This incantation can be cast while in motion or crouching, and
will still affect foes that are already in a combat state.
It is said that those beguiled by the shadow see within it a hated foe.

spells.name: Darkness
spells.effectDescription: Creates area of darkness that conceals caster.
spells.flavorText:
Incantation of the Two Fingers' servants, who once served as the assassins of the Roundtable Hold.
Creates a veil of darkness that conceals the caster. This incantation can be cast while in motion or crouching.
The assassins were themselves once Tarnished who had strayed from guidance, and they pursued their duty in the darkness that is without grace.

spells.name: Golden Vow
spells.effectDescription: Increases attack and defense for self and allies.
spells.flavorText:
An incantation of Erdtree Worship.
Increases attack power and defense for the caster and nearby allies. Hold to continue praying and delay activation.
This incantation has been taught to knights of the royal capital for generations, and knights sent on distant expeditions lean on it as a source of courage.

spells.name: Barrier Of Gold
spells.effectDescription: Greatly increases magic damage negation for self & allies.
spells.flavorText:
One of the incantations of Erdtree Worship.
Greatly increases magic damage negation for the caster and nearby allies. Hold to continue praying and delay activation.
This incantation was used by the champions of the Erdtree in the First and the Second Liurnian Wars, during which the red-haired Radagon joined the heroes' ranks.

spells.name: Golden Lightning Fortification
spells.effectDescription: Greatly increases lightning damage negation for self and allies.
spells.flavorText:
An incantation of Erdtree Worship.
Greatly increases lightning damage negation for the caster and nearby allies. Hold to continue praying, delaying the effect.
This incantation was used by the knights of the Erdtree during the assault by the great ancient dragon Gransax, and the bitter War of the Ancient Dragons that followed.

spells.name: Protection Of The Erdtree
spells.effectDescription: Increases affinity damage negation for self & allies.
spells.flavorText:
A superior incantation of Erdtree Worship.
Increase damage negation for all affinities except physical, for both the caster and nearby allies. Hold to continue praying and delay activation.
In the beginning, everything was in opposition to the Erdtree. But through countless victories in war, it became the embodiment of Order.

spells.name: Wrath Of Gold
spells.effectDescription: Produces golden shockwave that knocks back foes.
spells.flavorText:
Superior Erdtree Worship incantation.
Produces a golden shockwave that knocks back nearby foes. Charging increases the size of the shockwave.
This incantation was discovered when the Elden Ring was shattered, and it was feared as a sign of the Erdtree's wrath.

spells.name: Erdtree Heal
spells.effectDescription: Vastly heals HP for self and nearby allies.
spells.flavorText:
One of the ancient Erdtree incantations.
Heals a vast amount of HP for the caster and nearby allies. Hold to continue praying and delay activation.
The Erdtree once flourished with abundance - yet it was only for a fleeting moment. Such is the course of all life.

spells.name: Blessing's Boon
spells.effectDescription: Grants blessing to self and nearby allies.
spells.flavorText:
One of the ancient Erdtree incantations.
Grants a blessing to the caster and nearby allies, gradually restoring HP. Hold to continue praying and delay activation.
Blessings once fell like tears from the Erdtree, and this incantation is but a lingering remnant of their power.

spells.name: Blessing Of The Erdtree
spells.effectDescription: Grants greater blessing to self and nearby allies
spells.flavorText:
One of the ancient Erdtree incantations
Grants a greater blessing to the caster and nearby allies, gradually restoring a large amount of HP. Hold to continue praying and delay activation.
The Erdtree once flourished with abundance - yet it was only for a fleeting moment. Such is the course of all life.

spells.name: Aspects Of The Crucible: Breath
spells.effectDescription: Creates throat pouch to spew fire while walking.
spells.flavorText:
One of the ancient Erdtree incantations.
Creates a throat pouch on the caster's neck, allowing them to spew fiery breath while walking. Charging increases duration of the breath.
This is a manifestation of the Erdtree's primal vital energies - an Aspects of the primordial crucible, where all life was once blended together.

spells.name: Aspects Of The Crucible: Tail
spells.effectDescription: Creates supple tail to sweep area before caster.
spells.flavorText:
One of the ancient Erdtree incantations.
Creates a supple tail that sweeps through foes before the caster. Charging enhances potency.
This is a manifestation of the Erdtree's primal vital energies - an aspect of the primordial crucible, where all life was once blended together.

spells.name: Aspects Of The Crucible: Horns
spells.effectDescription: Creates shoulder horn to gore foes from a low stance.
spells.flavorText:
One of the ancient Erdtree incantations.
Creates a mighty horn on the caster's shoulder to gore foes from a low stance. Charging allows the caster to barrel into foes before delivering the final attack.
This is a manifestation of the Erdtree's primal vital energies - an aspect of the primordial crucible, where all life was once blended together.

spells.name: Elden Stars
spells.effectDescription: Creates a steam of golden shooting stars that assail the area..
spells.flavorText:
This legendary incantation is the most ancient of those that derive from the Erdtree.
Creates a stream of golden shooting stars that assail the area.
It is said that long ago, the Greater Will sent a golden star bearing a beast into the Lands Between, which would later become the Elden Ring.

spells.name: Black Blade
spells.effectDescription: Black blade spinning slash that emits wave of light.
spells.flavorText:
Power gleaned from the remembrance of Maliketh.
Caster creates an illusory black blade, then leaps forward to deliver a spinning slash that emits a wave of light. This can be followed up with one additional attack.
This blade was once imbued with Destined Death. In addition to dealing damage, it reduces foes' maximum HP and continues to sap their current HP for a very short time.

spells.name: Discus Of Light
spells.effectDescription: Fires ring of light before the caster.
spells.flavorText:
One of the incantations of the Golden Order fundamentalists.
Produces a ring of light and fires it forwards. The ring of light returns to a position close to the caster before disappearing. This incantation can be cast repeatedly.
A gift from the young Miquella to his father, Radagon.

spells.name: Triple Rings Of Light
spells.effectDescription: Fire three rings of light before the caster.
spells.flavorText:
One of the incantations of the Golden Order fundamentalists.
Produces three rings of light and fires them forwards. The rings of light return to a position close to the caster before disappearing. This incantation can be cast repeatedly.
A gift from the young Miquella to his father, Radagon.

spells.name: Radagon's Rings Of Light
spells.effectDescription: Creates golden ring of light to attack wide area.
spells.flavorText:
One of the incantations of the Golden Order fundamentalists. A gift of gratitude to the young Miquella from his father, Radagon.
Produces a golden ring of light and fires it across a wide area. Charging enhances range.
And yet, the young Miquella abandoned fundamentalism, for it could do nothing to treat Malenia's accursed rot. This was the beginning of unalloyed gold.

spells.name: Litany Of Proper Death
spells.effectDescription: Creates image of Order to deal holy damage.
spells.flavorText:
One of the incantations of the Golden Order fundamentalists. Used by hunters of Those Who Live in Death.
Creates an image of Order, dealing holy damage to nearby foes. This incantation is especially damaging to Those Who Live in Death. Any felled by this incantation cannot be revived.
The role of the hunters is to stamp out defiled reason  all for the perfection of the Golden Order.

spells.name: Order's Blade
spells.effectDescription: Enchanted right-hand armament with holy damage.
spells.flavorText:
One of the incantations of the Golden Order fundamentalists. Used by hunters of Those Who Live in Death.
Enchants armament held in the right hand with holy-affinity attacks. This incantation is especially damaging to Those Who Live in Death. Any felled by this incantation cannot be revived.
The role of the hunters is to stamp out defiled reason - all for the perfection of the Golden Order.

spells.name: Immutable Shield
spells.effectDescription: Increases left-hand shield's affinity/ailment resistance.
spells.flavorText:
One of the incantations of the Golden Order fundamentalists.
Enchants shield held in the left hand with the light of regression, increasing all forms of non-physical damage negation and ailment resistance.
Two concepts form the basis for Golden Order fundamentalism. One is the law of regression, to which this incantation relates.

spells.name: Law Of Causality
spells.effectDescription: Retaliates upon receiving a number of blows.
spells.flavorText:
One of the incantations of the Golden Order fundamentalists. One of the key fundamentals.
Manifests a small ring of causality within that allows the caster to automatically retaliate upon receiving a certain number of blows.
The fundamentalists describe the Golden Order through the powers of regression and causality. Causality is the pull between meanings; that which links all things in a chain of relation.

spells.name: Law Of Regression
spells.effectDescription: Heals all ailments and dispels all special effects.
spells.flavorText:
Incantation of the Golden Order fundamentalists. One of the key fundamentals.
Heals all negative statuses, dispels special effects, and reveals mimicry in all its forms.
The fundamentalists describe the Golden Order through the powers of regression and causality. Regression is the pull of meaning; that all things yearn eternally to converge.

spells.name: Lightning Spear
spells.effectDescription: Hurls lightning spear before caster.
spells.flavorText:
One of the incantations of the capital's ancient dragon cult.
Summons a lightning spear and hurls it before the caster. Charging causes a lightning bolt to strike the point of impact.
Long ago, Godwyn the Golden defeated the ancient dragon Fortissax, and befriended his fallen foe  an event that gave rise to the ancient dragon cult in the capital.

spells.name: Lightning Strike
spells.effectDescription: Summons lightning bolt that spreads from impact.
spells.flavorText:
One of the incantations of the capital's ancient dragon cult.
Summons a bolt of lightning that scatters and spreads around the surrounding area.
This incantation can be cast repeatedly.
Ancestors of the modern dragons, the ancient dragons had scales of Gravel Stone and wielded lightning as their weapon. It is said that they once attacked Leyndell, the Royal Capital.

spells.name: Honed Bolt
spells.effectDescription: Strikes foe with lightning bolt from above.
spells.flavorText:
One of the incantations of the capital's ancient dragon cult.
Summons a bolt of lightning to strike foes from above. This incantation can be cast repeatedly.
Long ago, Godwyn the Golden defeated the ancient dragon Fortissax, and befriended his fallen foe  an event that gave rise to the ancient dragon cult in the capital.

spells.name: Ancient Dragons' Lightning Spear
spells.effectDescription: Stabs with red lightning spear from above.
spells.flavorText:
A secret incantation of the capital's ancient dragon cult.
Creates a spear of red lightning and stabs it into the ground from above. On impact, the spear will burst into trails of lightning covering the area.
Spoken of in legend, red lightning is the weapon wielded by the ancient dragons.

spells.name: Ancient Dragons' Lightning Strike
spells.effectDescription: Summons red lightning that spreads from impact.
spells.flavorText:
A secret incantation of the capital's ancient dragon cult.
Summons a red bolt of lightning that scatters and spreads around the surrounding area.
Charging enhances the range of the lightning bolt.
Spoken of in legend, red lightning is the weapon wielded by the ancient dragons.

spells.name: Lansseax's Glaive
spells.effectDescription: Sweeps from above with red lightning glaive.
spells.flavorText:
Incantation that channels the power of the ancient dragon Lansseax.
Creates a red-lightning glaive and sweeps the area from above. This attack unleashes trails of lightning.
Lansseax was the sister of Fortissax. It is said that she took the form of a human to commune with the knights as a priestess of the ancient dragon cult.

spells.name: Fortissax's Lightning Spear
spells.effectDescription: Stabs from above with two red lightning spears in tandem.
spells.flavorText:
Incantation that channels the power of the ancient dragon Fortissax.
Creates two spears of red lightning and stabs them into the ground from above, one after another. On impact, each spear will burst into trails of lightning covering the area.
During the War of the Ancient Dragons, these twin red lightning stakes were the hallmark of the ancient dragon who was once called the mightiest boulderstone.

spells.name: Frozen Lightning Spear
spells.effectDescription: Stabs with ice lightning spear from above.
spells.flavorText:
Incantation that channels the power of the Dragonkin Soldiers.
Creates a spear of ice lightning and stabs it into the ground from above. On impact, the spear will burst into trails of lightning advancing forwards.
The Dragonkin were born in the Eternal City, where they knew no true sky, nor true lightning. Instead, ice lightning was their weapon.

spells.name: Death Lightning
spells.effectDescription: Strikes surroundings with storm of death lightning.
spells.flavorText:
Incantation that channels the power of the ancient dragon Fortissax, now corrupted by Death.
Strikes surroundings with a storm of Death lightning. Inflicts Death blight upon foes.
Charging extends duration of the storm.
It is said that this golden lightning was wielded by Godwyn, who befriended Fortissax.

spells.name: Electrify Armament
spells.effectDescription: Enchants right-hand armament with lightning damage.
spells.flavorText:
One of the incantations of the capital's ancient dragon cult.
Enchants armament held in the right hand with lightning-affinity attacks.
Long ago, Godwyn the Golden defeated the ancient dragon Fortissax, and befriended his fallen foe  an event that gave rise to the ancient dragon cult in the capital.

spells.name: Dragonbolt Blessing
spells.effectDescription: Bolsters caster's body with lightning.
spells.flavorText:
Superior incantation of the capital's ancient dragon cult.
Summons lightning to bolster the caster's body. Attacks become easier to deflect and resistance to all ailments is increased. However, lightning damage negation will be reduced.
Only those loved by dragons can survive the ordeal of cladding their bodies in lightning.

spells.name: Catch Flame
spells.effectDescription: Momentarily sparks flame from hand.
spells.flavorText:
Incantation originating from a sinister prophecy.
Momentarily sparks flame from the caster's hand. This incantation 
can be cast without delay after performing another action. 
The flame of ruin is anathema to the Erdtree. But prophets 
sometimes glimpse it within the faith all the same. Sadly when this 
occurs their sole reward is banishment.

spells.name: O Flame!
spells.effectDescription: Momentarily sparks roaring flame from hand.
spells.flavorText:
Incantation of the Fire Monks.
Momentarily sparks roaring flame from the caster's hand. 
Charging enhances potency.
The Giants' Flame still smolders upon the distant northern 
mountaintop, and the Fire Monks are its guardians.

spells.name: Flame Sling
spells.effectDescription: Throws balls of raging fire.
spells.flavorText:
Incantiation originating from a sinister prophecy.
Throws a ball of raging fire. Charging enhances potency and causes the ball of fire to explode.
The flame of ruin is anathema to the Erdtree. But prophets sometimes glimpse it within the faith all the same. Sadly when this occurs their sole reward is banishment.

spells.name: Giantsflame Take Thee
spells.effectDescription: Hurls massive ball of raging fire.
spells.flavorText:
One of the incantations that draws directly from the power of the Fire Giants.
Hurls a massive ball of raging fire. Charging enhances potency and causes the ball of fire to explode.
There is no record of this incantation in common prayerbooks. Only a select few prelates know of its existence.

spells.name: Flame Fall Upon Them
spells.effectDescription: Hurls several balls of fire at once.
spells.flavorText:
One of the incantations that draws directly from the power of the Fire Giants.
Hurls several balls of fire at once. Charging enhances potency and 
causes the balls of fire to explode.
There is no record of this incantation in common prayerbooks.
Only a select few prelates know of its existence.

spells.name: Flame Of The Fell God
spells.effectDescription: Summons raging fireball that explodes and sets the area ablaze.
spells.flavorText:
This legendary incantation is one of several that draws directly from the power of the Fire Giants.
Releases a ball of raging fire said to be inhabited by a fell god. The fireball floats toward enemies and explodes, setting the area ablaze.
Arghanthy, the chief guardian of the Flame, had kept this incantation a well-kept secret until it was stolen by Adan. The fell god still lurks within the Fire Giants.

spells.name: Surge O Flame!
spells.effectDescription: Incinerates area before caster with stream of fire.
spells.flavorText:
Superior incantation of the Fire Monks.
Creates a stream of fire to burn the area before the caster. This incantation can be cast while in motion.
Hold to maintain the effect.
The Giants' Flame is the flame of ruin, capable of burning the 
Erdtree. And so, following the War against the Giants, its ruinous 
blaze was sealed, and guardians were appointed to watch over it.

spells.name: Whirl O Flame!
spells.effectDescription: Sweeps area before caster with stream of fire.
spells.flavorText:
Superior Incantation of the Fire Monks.
Creates a spiraling stream of fire that burns the area before the caster. Charging enhances potency and reach.
Fire beguiles those who gaze into it. And so the guardians of the flame are also its worshippers.

spells.name: Burn O Flame!
spells.effectDescription: Raises a series of flame pillars around caster.
spells.flavorText:
One of the incantations that draws directly from the power of the Fire Giants.
Raises a series of flame pillars around the caster. Charging further increases the number of flame pillars.
The Fire Giants borrowed from the power of a fell god, and still they were defeated. Yet their failure released them from their solitary curse: to serve as keepers of the Flame for eternity.

spells.name: Flame Protect Me
spells.effectDescription: Greatly increases fire damage negation.
spells.flavorText:
The most ancient of the Fire Monks' incantations.
Creates a fire within that greatly increases fire damage negation.
It is said that this incantation was used during the War against the Giants long ago, during which it protected the champions of the Erdtree.

spells.name: Flame Grant Me Strength
spells.effectDescription: Raises physical and fire-affinity attack power.
spells.flavorText:
Superior incantation of the Fire Monks.
Creates an invigorating fire within that enhances physical and fire-affinity attack power.
This incantation does not burn the caster, and so it is considered forbidden by the guardians of the Flame.

spells.name: Fire's Deadly Sin
spells.effectDescription: Sets area and self ablaze with raging flames.
spells.flavorText:
Incantation originating from a deeply ominous prophecy.
Sets both the caster and the surrounding area ablaze with raging flames. The caster's body will remain engulfed in flame for a while, burning them and any who draw near. Charging enhances potency.
The prophet despaired, looking up at the Erdtree, for soon the kindling would burst into flame, bringing ruin.
"The burning of the Erdtree is the first cardinal sin. That is not the domain of mere men."

spells.name: Black Flame
spells.effectDescription: Throws a ball of raging black fire.
spells.flavorText:
A black flame incantation of the Godskin Apostles.
Throws a ball of raging black fire. Charging enhances potency and 
causes the fireball to explode.
Black flame is weighty. After dealing damage it continues to sap 
foes' HP for a very short time.

spells.name: Scouring Black Flame
spells.effectDescription: Sweeps area before caster with black flame.
spells.flavorText:
A black flame incantation of the Godskin Apostles.
Sweeps a wide area before the caster with black flame.
Charging enhances range.
The black flame could once slay gods. But when Maliketh sealed 
Destined Death, the true power of the black flame was lost.

spells.name: Black Flame Ritual
spells.effectDescription: Summons circle of black flame pillars around caster.
spells.flavorText:
Superior black flame incantation of the Godskin Apostles. 
Summons a circle of black flame pillars around the caster.
Charging increases the size of the circle.
The Gloam-Eyed Queen led the apostles. It is said that she was an 
Empyrean chosen by the Fingers.

spells.name: Black Flame Blade
spells.effectDescription: Enchants right-hand armament with black flame.
spells.flavorText:
A black flame incantation of the Godskin Apostles.
Engulfs armament held in the right hand with black flame. This incantation can be cast without delay after performing another action.
Black flame is weighty. After dealing damage it continues to sap foes' HP for a very short time.

spells.name: Black Flame's Protection
spells.effectDescription: Increases physical damage negation.
spells.flavorText:
A black flame incantation of the Godskin Apostles.
Summons black fire within, increasing physical damage negation. However, sacred flasks and other such forms of HP restoration are impaired.
The Apostles were all embraced by the Gloam-Eyed Queen, and the black flame was their armor within.

spells.name: Noble Presence
spells.effectDescription: Thrust out belly with gusto to unleash repelling shockwave.
spells.flavorText:
Ancient power of the Godskin Nobles.
Thrust out belly with gusto to produce a shockwave that knocks back nearby foes.
Charging enhances potency, knocking enemies into the air.
Once a sign of the gods' wrath, this incantation became a trophy of the Nobles' god hunt.

spells.name: Beast Claw
